description:
Tips, tips:

Don't be afraid to order an entire plate of the mini chicken tinga tostadas for yourself, you will be happy you did.

Do feel free to play scrabble, though it should be noted that the bar's two sets are missing some letter tiles.

Don't order cocktails unless you specify your booze if you are over 30. The well liquor is hangover-inducing. 

Don't sit near the big window if its open and the staff is trying to close it. You'll be asked to move for about 20 minutes.

Try to remember to bring cash but if all else fails, they take debit.

Always order two plates of the spinach balls. 

The veggie burger is on an english muffin. This is delicious.

On weekday nights with the DJ spinning and the relative quiet otherwise, it can be a lovely place to grab a slow dinner date - or with friends over small bites and with games. Do it! Do it!
author: Archana P.

description: I love this place! Great Tapas, Great Drinks, fun bar activities! Its the tits! Board Games, trivia, music, art and more Asiento has a lot to give ya. It Has a homie vibe with plenty of seating! Check it out for sure!
author: Lani A.

description:
Review for drinks only.

Overall: great little spot for drinks with reasonable prices, with funky tunes from the dj and a low key vibe.

If you check in with Yelp, you get a discount on a premium cocktail ($7 bucks!). I checked in but didn't get a cocktail. I was driving, so I wanted to go with something a bit lower proof.

It's a Spanish-inspired place, and they have a few Spanish wines by the glass as well as some others from various global and domestic locales. I asked and received a taste of the Tempranillo. It was decent and I had a glass of it. The bartender was very friendly about the taste, which I always appreciate. Who wants to commit to a full glass when it might not be to your liking? 

They have a full bar and a pretty long list of craft cocktails to choose from. They also have beer on tap.

Asiento serves what looked like a broad variety of tapas and share plates, but I didn't have anything to eat. I definitely would be interested in giving the food a try in the future.

Atmosphere: It wasn't very crowded on a Tuesday night, and that was perfectly fine with me. It has a neighborhood-y feel--something more upscale than a dive, but still casual, friendly and approachable. Seating options include tables, the bar, and some leather couches and chairs. It's a good date place or a place to get a casual drink after work.
author: Sara E.

description:
Low-key neighborhood type of bar. 

What I like about Asiento:

1) Happy hour cocktails for $7.
2) TV to watch the Warriors game!
3) Spacious with plenty of seating all around. 
4) Great cocktail selections...Mezcal.
5) Awesome bartender. 

I hope you give this great bar a try. Cheers!
author: Owie N.

description: This delightful place is off the beaten path in the mission. They often have live DJ's spinning tunes. Drinks are tasty and decent. The small bites are much more delicious than a typical bar's offerings. The have interesting artwork on display that I guess is changed out occasionally.  What I like as someone visiting from New York City is that this place doesn't have the typical "douche-bag" feel that several other San Francisco bars seem to have acquired.  I like this place, it feels like a neighborhood place in Brooklyn.
author: Peter B.

description: I was invited to a friend's birthday gathering at Asiento. Appetizers from Asiento were served - everything chosen was vegetarian and delicious! I'm not a vegetarian, but the grilled pepper bocadillos were delicious, as was the lemon hummus - crispy bread and yummy, garlicky hummus. I tried a couple of the artsy beverages. My favorite was the pomegranate strawberry cocktail. The atmosphere is warm and vibrant, low lighting and generous floor area for dancing. I was pleasantly wowed by the delicious food, special drinks, friendly service and great music! I'll be back -
author: Stas R.

description: Friendly staff, great owner, wonderful tapas, comfortable atmosphere, great drinks, good music and djs.  Highly recommended.
author: Charles L.

description:
Friendly place, they made a drink under my name for my birthday -how sweet is that!
We always feel welcome here. Love my neighborhood bar.
author: Martine P.

description:
This is my favorite neighborhood bar! First of all, the bartender made a hella good mocktail for me ( Just because I'm pregnant, doesn't mean I can't go to bars!)

We have tried:

Thai spring rolls- refreshing.
Queso fundido- this is so damn good. I went back after work once just to order this to eat and then left.
Crab cakes - a little bit on the dry side.
Some sauteed shrimp- the flavor was really garlicky! I like it.
Lemon hummus- decent.
Guacamole- I devoured this in seconds! I felt bad for the people that came later because this dish was all gone before they arrived :x.

Overall, I loved almost everything! I can't wait until I can drink again because I definitely want to come back to try their cocktails!!
author: Josie H.

description: Up All Night(the EDM nightclub app) hosted an event here at Asiento. Zane brought me. It was Taco Tuesday today and so we had some tacos. I had 4 at $2.50 each and Zane had 2 shrimp for $3.50 each. I had 2 chicken and 2 beef. They were a bit small and lacking some topping to go with the meat. It needed more taste basically. But it was pretty good, just not A plus fantastic. The bartender lady was really nice and friendly. Zane got a free sangria because he is on Up All Night. This place is tucked away in the Mission, but it's in a decent area.
author: Denise C.

description:
Love the food here and the ambiance. Cool low key place for drinks, music and some bites. I've been to Asiento a handful of times and even recommended it to friends. 

Unfortunately last night both bartenders failed to acknowledge my cousin and I when we first sat at the bar. We grabbed a drink menu from another customer and patiently waited to be acknowledged. Finally our order was taken and when we received our drinks the bartender shared that she might of made my drink wrong and to let me know if I'd like her to do it over. We also waited very long for our food to come. After one round of drinks and some food we decided to spend the rest of our night at another bar. 

Really like this place, but I hope the customer service is better next time.
author: Carlos O.

description: This bar has a good feel.  We ate dinner here and had queso fundito, meatballs, spring rolls, and beet salad.   It was all pretty good.
author: Michael E.

description:
When I'm being fickle about what to eat, tapas are always a safe bet. I can try a little of everything and my tastebuds will be happy from the variety. So on the often occasion that I'm eating late but don't know what to eat, I open yelp, type tapas, click Open Now, and pick one. Asiento always comes up in my search because the kitchen conveniently closes an hour before the bar closes, which is 11pm Sun-Wed and midnight Thurs-Sat. 

3 stars because I didn't realize this place is more of a bar than a restaurant. I was just starving and wanted to finally check this place out, but I was thrown off because there was a legit bouncer at the door checking IDs. I guess that's my bad because I didn't thoroughly sieve through photos and reviews, but I figured maybe it'll be like one of those cool gastropubs or hopefully even a nice Latin American bar w/ food.

My hopes were set too high. I got inside and it was SUPER divey. There was a live DJ but the music was like James Brown radio on Pandora. It's ironic because for a place called "Asiento" (Spanish for "seat"), it was pretty hard to find somewhere to sit. There are a few couches and bar seating, all of which were taken, so we squished with another couple to use their table because they were just chatting. 

Honestly I was too hungry to scramble and switch locations, so we proceeded to order. The food was decent:
-BOCADILLOS: Sandwich w/ your choice of meat (we chose carnitas), and it was the best thing we ordered. Bread was nicely toasted and the carnitas were flavorful
-GAMBAS: pretty much gambas al ajillo, not bad but they only give you 4 pcs of shrimp. They served it with grilled bread, but there wasn't enough white wine sauce on the plate to really soak up.
-QUESO FUNDIDO: Cheese fondue w/ chorizo. The flavor was all there and I would have really liked this, except the cheese was not really melted into a fondue. The chips were breaking trying to scoop it so I had to eat the cheese in chunks with a fork.
-ASSORTED CHEESE AND SALAMI PLATE: Meh! The brie was fine, but the other two cheeses were as if they went to Safeway or Target and bought a cheese platter. These were thick slices of American-like cheese, so not very appetizing to my palette. The salami and olives salvaged this dish.

Specialty cocktails were also decent but honestly just not up to par with other places that specialize in mixology. On paper, the flavors looked good. My first drink had strawberries, mezcal, and some sort of chili pepper, which my bf ordered for me because he knows that's my ish, and it was good but not amazing. For my second drink, I ordered something else that also had a spicy kick except with passionfruit and tequila... same reaction. I think the combinations are right, but the balances are off. Good drinks, just not amazing.

Now on another night when I'm not specifically looking for food, I'd give this place another chance if I'm feeling like it's a low key dive bar kind of night. Or if I'm in the area and my prospects for really late decent dining are getting slim, I would not mind getting those bocadillos again. But as a whole, I would not plan a night around here. Too many hipsters.
author: Stephanie Joyce D.

description: Really chillin bar if you're looking for a relaxing time or a party, this is the place you want to be! Good variety of food, drinks, music and people. The tostadas are off the chainwax!
author: Willow C.

description: Perhaps best known for innovative mixed drinks and tacos, but the chicks really know how to party, even if they have an attitude
author: Rich R.

description: Few times I been here I loved it.  Awesome chill atmosphere, great drinks, good happy hour prices. Very nice bartenders. Never disappointed
author: Karen B.

description: This place was so great when it first opened. As the hip atmosphere has been maintained, their food has taken a plunge. Once a place with exotic, bright flavored-tapas is now a place of you-can-make-this-yourself. I still enjoyed the fun cocktails, music and abundance amount of boardgames to choose from. With a few menu changes, this place could be where it was 5 years ago.
author: Michelle B.

description: I came here at the end of my night to grab some random tapas so I don't recall too much. I do remember getting the Queso Fondido which was just alright. Beware, lactose intolerant people. I'd classify this spot as a dive, but they do still play music that's somewhat loud. It's not the most essential place you need to visit in SF, but not bad if you're just in the area stumbling around.
author: Marlon T.

description:
I'm feelin' this spot! 

I've become somewhat of a night owl over this summer (maybe it's my circadian rhythm...or maybe it's becoming unemployed, who knows!), so when I went to look up a cool casual bar/lounge that served food on a Saturday night, Asiento popped up.  Lo and behold, we pulled up and I was like "Hey,  I remember when it was Cosmos (I think that was the name) years ago."

By all accounts, Asiento is a sweet upgrade to its predecessor.  It's dimly lit, very Mission-cool, casual, and if you're looking for a full bar with cocktails, beer, a small but decent wine selection, they got it down!

Couches, bar seating, and communal table seating.  You walk in, order your food and drinks at the bar, sit down somewhere, and they serve it.  If I had anything negative to say, it's that they don't have actual printed menus (you have to look at the chalkboard or the little handwritten board that's on the bar).  So it's kinda inconvenient.

But the FOOD!  Just what I needed at 11pm on a Saturday.  I forgot what time they stopped serving, but boy was I happy to just be somewhere other than Beretta for late night bites.  

*DO NOT MISS the Spinach Balls
*Lemon Hummus is amazing
*Beet Salad is super fresh and delicious

Other than that, I just wish I had pictures to share...But let's just say that I'll be back!
author: Angella S.

description:
Great locals' place for a craft beer/specialty cocktail/tapas.

The ambiance is fantastic (kind of like a cross between a dark bookstore and a quiet gaming venue), the staff is genuine and the food is actually VERY good, considering that Asiento is technically a "bar with food." (I mean, they are a bar with food, but I'd go there just to eat the food even if they didn't have a bar.)

Keep up what you're doing - really something special you've got going there!
author: Ashley M.

description:
One of Mission District's hidden gems! I used to go there all the time before I moved away. Now I'm moving back and I can't wait to visit again. The bar itself has a very intimate but open feel, with dim lights, high ceilings, and nice natural lighting throughout the day. Although the tapas are great, I recommend you visit this place if you are looking to snack on something while you have a drink, not necessarily for dinner. The 5 stars is definitely based on the local being a bar, not a tapas restaurant. That being said, the food is pretty good. You should definitely try the queso fundido with chorizo and the deviled eggs. And of course, the cocktails are even better. 

There's also a lot of entertainment options. Not only is there a bar and a high top table area, but there are also couches where you can sit and play board games with your friends. Bookshelves contain a good number options for you to peek at. I remember I spent one night going through a huge Atlas book with my friends. That time was actually a Tuesday night, and they had a DJ playing chill electronic vibes and it was perfect for the room. It is also well to mention that the staff is really nice and even remembered me when I visited after a couple of weeks! All in all, a really nice lounge experience.
author: Francette D.

description:
Eh.. Idk. 

This place is weak. I thought it'd be better but it's just ok. It's a divey-type bar with a dance floor and a DJ. I mean it's a cool place for a small group of friends to have a no-planned evening. Great for beers, maybe tapas? and just a short hangout for the night. 

Me and some friends came for a friend's bday party last night and it was alright. Sure, I got to dance and get my two-stop in, but that was about it. It can get a bit too stuffy in here and too hot. We left cause we needed to wipe the sweat off and breathe.
author: Allister D.

description:
The food was generally bad, and extremely inconsistent. We made the mistake of ordering more and hoping the second round of dishes would be better - they weren't. My cocktail tasted like cough syrup, which didn't help.

Pretty good:
The bread grilled in garlic olive oil - you get about a quarter of a baguette for $2 which felt a little stingy but also could have been the best value on the menu if they didn't double-charge us for it.
The devilled eggs - the usual plus a bit of relish and bacon on top, which seemed unnecessary but didn't hurt.
The crab cake salad - I won't even be snarky about this one it was actually delicious.

Meh: The sausage with mustard. The gambas.

Avoid:
The queso fundido. We were told this was a "filling" dish if we were hungry. We were in fact hungry, but this is the last thing we should have ordered. The thing about serving melted cheese is that you need to start with cheese, and not rubber. Trying to dip or scoop some of this cheese onto a chip was like trying to dissect a dead animal with a bookmark. It was like taking a slice of pizza where the cheese either falls off the slice completely, or you pick up the entire pizza's cheese attached to your single slice. You get the point - the melted cheese wasn't melted.
The hummus, which was flavorless and chunky and which should come with more than a few tiny slivers of bread.
The spring rolls, which were extremely bland, served on a plate of sauce which tasted like simple syrup suspending bits of red bell pepper, which actually made the rolls taste even less flavorful. The highlight of this dish was that it provoked an interesting philosophical question at our table: can a dish have a negative amount of flavor?

They have trivia nights and games, so maybe come for one of those as long as you order beer (they can't mess that up, right?) and avoid most of the food.
author: Chris M.

description: Last night I was dancing at Asiento and set my purse down, when I turned around it was gone. I was concerned that my purse had been stolen so I consulted the bouncer and the owner (who happened to be onsite). They were both SO helpful- offering advice, helping me look, letting me use their phone to use Find My iPhone, etc. I eventually found my purse (someone had moved it across the bar) but I just had to post on Yelp! because they were so helpful and kind while I was looking for it. Awesome customer service!!
author: Katie S.

description: Still a big fan! Everything I need when I need to defuse, wind down and breathe again.  Tapas are top notch & I love Deb's soothing vibe. Great drinks all around great place!
author: A F.

description: Pretty cool setup and space with couches games and dj. Food not bad but service was piss poor. Friendly staff but incapable of serving at capacity. The place was dead tonight with only a handful of people and still we had to wait ages at the bar just to order.
author: K R.

description: My friends and I were looking for a bar to hang at before our late night dinner reservations nearby. So glad we found this place! Delicious cocktails, tasty finger foods and friendly bartenders! The chill atmosphere on a Saturday night was surprising, but perfect. We could have spent hours playing board games and drinking if it wasn't for our previous dinner commitment. I'll definitely be back.
author: Jessica B.

description: A great neighborhood bar. The cocktails are tasty. I haven't eaten there, but the food smells amazing. They have a trivia night on Monday, and lots of board games to play. The music isn't loud, so it's a great place to go if you want to be able to hear the people you're talking to. Cash is preferred, debit accepted, credit cards not accepted.
author: Shannon Y.

description: Brad is the best bartender the world has ever known! Also Debi is great. I met this guy Christoph in two tank tops and it was pretty hot.
author: Andrea G.

description: They have a good variety of tapas. Not traditional tapas but really delicious food! The cocktails are so flavorful and refreshing. Also they have live music!
author: Alex H.

description:
Came to celebrate Pine Street Brewery's 2nd Anniversary at Asiento. 

Such a cute spot that we have never tired before. Modern Decor, Tables, Benches, Bar and Stools, Live Music, Board Games.. a little bit of everything!

Taco Tuesday hosts $2.50 tacos (and $3.50 for shrimp taco), $4 Chips and Salsa, Drink Specials and a kind, peppy Burning Man-going Bartender/ Owner. 

Mini Tacos are pretty darn tasty. We devoured 3 Pork, 2 Beef, 1 Chicken and 1 Shrimp taco's between the two of us and each one had its own distinct flavor and sauce. The chipotle on the beef and pork was beautifully spicy while the shrimp and chicken had a softer verde to accompany the more tender flavors. All the meat(s) were tender and juicy.. No complaints here! 

We would come back for some delightful munchies again, maybe hit up Trivia Monday's!
author: Meghan L.

description:
While visiting San Francisco, we stayed at an Airbnb in the Mission District near Bryant and 22nd.  We decided to go out one night and were planning to head downtown, but my husband stumbled across this place as he had walked down to purchase some things from a nearby grocery.  We decided to give it a try and were glad we did!  They had a list of really cool different cocktails, and the bartender seemed very knowledgeable.  I loved the cocktail I tried!  We also got some appetizers that were pretty delicious.  Their concept of deviled eggs is not the same as our midwestern appetites were used to, but everything else was good!  

My friends were a little disappointed in the lack of energy among other patrons.  We went on a Saturday night; there was a DJ who was playing some good music and open space on the floor, but no one was dancing.  (One of my friends went up to the DJ to see if he took requests but he did not.) If you are looking for a more energetic, dance-worthy environment, this is not it.  However, it was a great place to grab a drink on our search for a night club.  

There seemed to be a range of ages among the patrons, and it definitely felt more like a local place than the tourist traps near the Wharf.  I'm glad we came here instead of going downtown! 
 Overall, the place had a really cool vibe with great drinks.  I would definitely come here again if I ever visit SF again.
author: Megan S.

description:
Drunkenly jumped into an Uber ride with friends and got out at ... Asiento.

Hip little bar in the deep Mission.  It's dark, has a small dance floor and a mixed crowd of locals and newcomers.  Reminds me of bars in the Lower Haight, where you can dance your ass off, or just chill at the bar, talking to someone new.

Be warned, the drink prices are no break.  $10 for a basic mixed drink.  Ouch.
author: Sondra H.

description: Service at the bar was pretty good but the rest of the experience sucked. Hard to find a table, food was small bites and very underwhelming, the place turned from a "restaurant" to a shitty euro bar with a dj who played house music and took no requests. It got pretty empty pretty fast...I wonder why ‍ we'll see how long this place lasts
author: Audrey H.

description:
SUCH A GREAT FIND. I really truly love this place. I could go here every day. The drinks rocked. I got the "Cucumber Rosemary" drink and "The Good Idea" drink. Both were delicious, however I did like the Cucumber Rosemary drink a little bit better. I also tried the Basil Lemonade which was also deeeelicious. We got here on a Sunday night around 7pm and it was pretty chill, not too many people here but the bartender was super friendly and talkative, making us feel welcome. 

We also ordered chips and guac which was a great call. My two friends and I played Jenga for awhile, which someone so kindly wrote dares on each jenga block - ranging from "kiss the person to your right" to "make your best O face of the person to your left" and "stand on your chair and thank everyone for coming tonight" etc. etc. By 8:30 ish the bar was wayy more packed and it seems like a well rounded bar in the sense that it can go from really chill vibe to super packed and dance-y in a short amount of time. 

They also have tapas, which i have yet to try but mark my word, i will be back very very soon.
author: Ilana B.

description:
Asiento is such a class act - run by people who have a phenomenal understanding of San Francisco and the unique bar and lounge culture in this city.

I was in charge of helping organize a low-key bachelorette night for 4 lovely ladies. 

The first place that came to mind was Asiento.

Asiento has it all.

Is is located away from much of the pedestrian and car traffic of the Mission - but it is still close enough to it all - that you could easily walk there from many other hip destination spots in the area.

Asiento is fairly mellow on the weekdays. They even have a vast array of board games if you want something interactive to do with some friends. 

On the weekend - Asiento blooms.  They have great DJs - who will spin during the evening - and if you're looking to dance - Asiento will have you grooving in your seat - or on their decent sized dance floor.

If you're more interested in imbibing on some stellar freshly muddled cocktails and nibbling on an impressive array of delectable finger foods - Asiento has both mastered. 

Seriously.

My friends couldn't stop gushing about the food.  With menu items such as: Spinach Balls made with blanched spinach and jalapeno-lemon aioli and Gambas  - comprised of sauteed shrimp with garlic and white wine -  Asiento truly excels at presenting well proportioned tapas dishes that are light enough to allow you to dance, but filling enough that you won't be hungry later on in the evening. And the best part?  - The price. And for those with food concerns - they also carry gluten free bread and can accommodate many dietary restrictions. 

Their drinks are just as wowing. Though I don't drink - I tried both of my friends' drinks during the evening and I was impressed with how balanced each drink was. Moe -is an award-winning mixologist and he will go out of his way to make sure that each manifested drink is welcomed with a smile.

As we shook our shoulders to the weekend beats in Asiento that blissful bachelorette evening- we admired the diversity of the crowd. Everyone donned a huge grin. The staff were just as excited to be there.

There are a lot of great spots in this city for a weekend night out - but if you want a truly excellent experience with artful drinks and food - come to Asiento. If you're looking to plan a big event  - also contact Asiento. They own the space above Asiento and they are able to accommodate bigger groups with true San Francisco flare and ease.

Trust.
author: Jessica T.

description: Casual bar with a quaint location and delicious selection of tapas. Taco Tuesday's are the highlight, as you can get two for $2.50-$3.50. Sangria is refreshing, a must try.
author: Sebastian L.

description: Burger is delicious - don't forget to order queso fundido + chorizo.  Christina's drinks were tasty and provided great service.  The bathrooms are clean too +
author: R Salvatore R.

description: Wow!!! Great drinks and atmosphere. It's everything you want in a tapas bar. See Debi the owner, she's amazing.
author: Kathy H.

description:
Decided to try a new place and ended up at asiento. It was pretty empty when we got there on a Saturday night. It was more a bar than a restaurant. We ordered some drinks and a couple of the small plates. The only one that stood out was the 'camarones a la diabla'. If we ever go again I'm definitely just ordering a bunch of those. 

They also have board games like apples to apples, trivia, etc.
author: Laura D.

description:
Nice bar. Cool vibes. It feels like a place to come here with people you already know, not to mingle and meet.

I was dying of hunger and while waiting for friends scarfed down the veggie burger on an English muffin which I thought was quite tasty. It came out so hot and I didn't wait a single moment, I burned my tongue. 

I'm not sure if I've become especially frugal, or just go to cheap Mexican joints too often so my opinions are all skewed; I thought the tapas prices were a little high for the portions. 

I wanted to try their signature basil lemonade, but I was on a descent to being full blown sick I skipped the cocktail and asked for a hot drink. Bar tender recommended cognac with some syrup and lemon. It went down easy and my throat loved it. 

They have a Yelp check in deal for the basil lemonade cocktail. All the ingredients are presented beautifully right on the bar. I also liked the set up of high table seating and lounge chairs in the back. There are lots of board games to play. It's a great place to come with a few friends and chill for a long while. 

Note that they don't accept credit card. Only cash, debit and those digital payment apps. Cool vibes.
author: Priti K.

description:
Nice neighborhood bar with good food and good service, owner works the bar and she is very friendly and accommodating. I will frequent again
!!!
author: Kevin T.

description: Grabbed a bite and drinks here with a friend after work. Dark, taverny flair with a bit of a lounge feel. Took a seat at the bar and was greeted by the bartender. Ordered a snakebite (1/2 cider 1/2 stout for those who do not know) and gambas, crab cakes.. and honestly I forgot what else but they were so good!! Very casual place to catch up over drinks and small bites. Would recommend.
author: Genevieve M.

description: Honestly the spot is super cute and we went for Trivia. Being in the mission the drinks are pretty high, and the food while good was insanely small portions for the price especially considering they are tapas. It for sure has a great mood and vibe. Trivia was league play and not as rowdy or interactive as I would like but perfect for the person that is all about the game and the challenge as opposed to the social aspects of it.
author: Morgan S.

description:
Came here thinking nothing of it. It used to be the Monkey Bar way back when, and I'd always wanted to come here for my first drink as a 21 year old. Clearly...it did not happen...as it closed before I turned 21 way back when.

I checked in to get the $7 for a specialty drink, which is normally $9.50. It's kind of interesting, because evidently the businesses pay yelp for the ability to advertise a discount...so they can get more reviews and visibility? I don't mind. Its $2.5 off for me! 

Per usual, I get distracted by the drink name. I got The Good Idea. Which, wasn't a bad idea at all. The drinks aren't strong (I had a sip of multiple drinks), but if was ok. Nicely made, actually. There was some thought put into the specialty drinks.

The food...initially would have put me at placing this place at a solid 3 stars. Overall, it came in way too small portions (even as tapas), and the flavor was kind of meh. Of all the tapas, I'd go with the squid in sauce because the sauce is delicious. There needed to be more bread with it. No need to grill the bread, just gimmie bread for that sauce! The squid was done well, and when you cook squid in sauce, it's easy for it to be over or under cooked. Well done, chef!

The other foods were just ok. Quick summary:

Guacamole: Came out pretty, but the long chips makes it hard to eat without double dipping. So if you're germ phobe, no bueno.

Spinach balls: Really odd tasting. Lots of spinach, but there was something else in there making it...weird tasting. Its like a green falafal ball.

Thai Spring Roll: Was just a sour sauce with fresh spring roll. Nothing Thai about it. I just tasted basil and bell peppers.

Fried Chicken Spring Roll: DON'T GET THIS THINKING ITS FRIED CHICKEN!!! That's what we all thought and it was severely disappointing. It is a chicken spring roll that's been fried. So. Chicken Spring Roll. I think the fresh ones are considered summer rolls.  Sauce was good, food was not. Hurm...i see a trend. 

Chicken Kabobs: Was ok. The chicken was pretty juicy, and is basically ground chicken meat on skewers. 

So...what bumped me from the solid 3 up to a 4 star?? The Juicy Burger. Seriously, of all things. Juicy burger. The flavors were really great in the meat, though I'm not 100% sure how I feel about the English Muffin bun. It was made mid-rare, which...it did not look like when I first bit into it. However, on hindsight, I think the way they marinated the meat made the meat darker, because even though it LOOKED mid-well, it TASTED mid-rare. 

Plus, the owner is a pretty stellar person. She was very nice in talking to us (until it got busy), and wasn't afraid to get her hands dirty. If I had ONE critique about the layout, I'd say that she needs more tables further away from the bar. I saw her servers having to maneuver through a very dense crowd by the bar, but there was NO one in the open space between the bar and bathrooms. I felt bad for the server, and people didn't move out of his way. Seriously, if someone is trying to get through to deliver food to another patron, you should MAKE WAY. Instead of looking over, looking down at them, and continuing talking. I'm talking to you, white group in their 40's!! Maybe if there were tables on that side, people would be more likely to move over? Unless its a dance floor I'm unaware of?
author: Lily W.

description:
I like how this place has more than just 1-2 veggie options to order.  The drink menu is interesting as well. 

The bartender is super sweet and really easy to talk to.  She also really cares about her customers (made conversation, and when we left our table to check out the menu on the wall, she watched our stuff since she was concerned someone would take it-stupidly we left our purse/wallet on the table, but we weren't too far from them!)

For drinks, I ordered the basil lemonade with tequila instead of lemon vodka and it was good but a slightly sweeter taste would have been fantastic.  The basil flavor was nice (just wish I had a spoon to scoop up all the basil that settled to the bottom!) My friend got a beer and liked it.

For food, we ordered the spinach balls, which were okay, better than expected but not amazing.  We also ordered the veggie burger; I must say that I really hope the burger was vegetarian because it tasted exactly like meat. I heard the server say it had butternut squash and some other veggies in it; I didn't taste any of that; again, it tasted like meat.  It was pretty good but just a lil concerning.  I guess if it tasted that real, then it's a great option for meat eaters! My friend liked the burger and is a meat eater.  The portion size was TINY! I was still hungry after eating lol. 

May return if I am in the area.
author: Monica J.

description: Super friendly owner and great veggie burger! We were there Saturday night with funky live music.
author: Jassi P.

description:
Randomly came to this bar last night with a group of friends. Good venue overall and enjoyed the ambience of the place. Bartenders were great, poured drinks exactly, better to be exact than shorted. 

However I didn't appreciate the rudeness I received from Logan while ordering our first round. Look, I get it there's a lot of people at the bar and you just want to make my drink and move on to the next one. But while it maybe more convenient for YOU to make a Manhattan and Old Fashioned at the same time, my friend specifically asked you about the Yelp check in cocktail choices last, and after we all had ordered our drinks. To make matters worse we still got charged full price. 

Lastly, while I'm not going going make a big deal over a coupe of bucks, automatically giving yourself a 20% tip for all my transactions when I signed off for 18% really left a bad lasting impression.
author: Patrick L.

description: Screw the bartender. My friend and I showed up here for a birthday party. Shortly after arriving she realized she left her wallet but still wanted to celebrate the birth of our dear friend. The blonde bartender working around 8:30 on Wednesday night (3/15) was very rude and abrasive towards her for not having an ID. Even tho she asked to just have water. He said he wouldn't serve her and that he wouldn't allow us to hang out. I get that it's a liability to have undocumented people in a bar but he could have dealt with the situation differently. Manners and common decency go a long way. I'm never coming back here. Zero stars for asiento and negative 10 stars for the douchy guy serving drinks.
author: Ryan M.

description: Five stars for being my favorite burger in SF: Asian-inspired flavors, minimalist toppings, served on an English muffin. Also like the vibe! Cozy! Board games.
author: Liz M.

description: We went here for dinner & a drink after Farmhouse Thai was too full to take us. It was an early Wednesday night and somewhat empty so we were surprised by the extremely loud live music. The music itself wasn't bad, but the musician was playing so loudly that it was hard to hear each other talk. The food was ok but seemed overpriced for the amount and the quality. We got the sauteed calamari which was quite chewy and rubbery. We also got the (meat) burger and the tostadas de tinga, which were both pretty good but extremely small portions. I think this place might just be more of a bar spot.
author: Maya E.

description:
I like this place. GREAT tunes. Also, if you're celebrating a birthday, the bar will promote the name behind the bar and you get a drink. Like my friend had Moscow Mule for her birthday.

Few knocks though. 

1, The place gets busy. Granted, I came here on a Saturday night around 10pm and the place was packed. But, the crowd emptied out between 11.30 and midnight.

2. This place is cash only.

I'll still come back for a return visit.
author: John M.

description:
I didn't like the place at all, I felt like is a scam on many levels.
I didn't like the fact that they have not a real glace of wine, instead I had to drink my wine in a Whiskey glass, which obviously killing the folklore of just drinking wine, I felt like the food is mostly frozen, I order the Gambas which was good, but it says 4 pieces on the menu and only 2 came (scam) and about the sausages, there are mostly the cheap one that you can buy at the liquor store. No fun at all especially when it is costly, dont get me wrong i dont mind paying for the food, I just want something not frozen and the quality you show on your menu

I won't recommended it and I won't go back.
author: Jeremy P.

description:
Awesome Neighborhood Bar!  

This isn't a trendy or upscale destination, it IS a chill neighborhood bar with good cocktails, a wide variety of tasty plates, and nightly entertainment with DJs, trivia, and board games. With several vegetarians and a vegan in our group, everyone was able to find a couple of plates - not your typical pub grub!
author: Brian G.

description: Their queso fundido is everything.  Great cocktails and bartenders! Enjoy.
author: Marisa I.

description: I loved the vibe of this place! Great for if you are not super hungry and want a great cocktail. I really appreciated how the bartenders put a lot of effort into perfecting each drink.
author: Jenny H.

description: I celebrated my birthday here a few weeks ago. I made a reservation and they were in touch with me immediately. Debi was super nice from the very beginning and was super helpful. She asked what my favorite drink was so she could have it as a special that day. The food - the food is delicious. Their mini tacos, guacamole and queso fundido are so good. Would have liked it if there was a DJ playing that night though, it seemed like the music kicked in kind of slow. Other than that everything was great.
author: Silvia P.

description:
Best. Bar. Ever.

I've been meaning to write this review for ages. I love this place - I found it on a random afternoon with some friends. We went in, had wine, and played games all afternoon. The bartender was super friendly and never rushed us or shushed us - we were there for hours and had a great time!

I also had my birthday party here. They let me reserve a section of the room and pick all the music for the night. They asked me what my favorite cocktail was and made that the special. I really cannot say enough good things about this bar - just go here and experience it yourself!
author: Rashmi J.

description: Always a good time at this place ! Debbie is one of the most friendliest people ever. Great neighborhood bar
author: Laura F.

description: Great venue!  Recently held a friend's milestone birthday and everyone had a great time.  Debi, the owner is very friendly, accommodating and really an overall wonderful hostess.  She works with you and what your needs and wishes our for the big day.  They also have a great selection of drinks, cocktails and food.  They even had a number of vegan and gluten-free options.  The location is also very central in the mission.
author: Caroline S.

description: This place is super chill and very eclectic. The tapas range from great to not good but you'd have to try and figure out what you prefer.  My fiancée loved the burger but didn't like the tostada where I liked both.  They have a DJ that adds a little 80's flare at times and then changes up to house-esk.
author: Jessica L.

description: We really love going to Asiento for a bite, a great drink and a lovely atmosphere.  I am thankful to have this business in the neighborhood and we've always really enjoyed the experience.  FWIW, several others mentioned being upset by the no hat policy - In my experience, many bars do not allow sports hats.  My husband has been asked to remove his hat every time we've gone in and now he knows to leave it at home.  See you again soon, Asiento!
author: Autumn B.

description:
The vibe can range from chill and loungey (which it was when we went on a Tuesday eve) to outright party (which some others experienced on a Friday eve).  For food, the veggie burger and Gambas were the big winners here... and I liked the dark beer I had but I can't remember its name!

Cash or debit cards only.
author: Aaron M.

description:
Trivia on Monday's!

They prefer cash.

Fun drink list and full bar.

The food they serve is tasty - but tapa sized.  
- Queso is good, but greasy.
- Burger is excellent, but should probably be called a slider.
- Guacamole is great, but I wish they gave you more chips.  I like my chips on the side, not all sticking out of my guacomole.  

The trivia starts at 8:30 and moves pretty quickly.  Will definitely come again - after climbing @ Mission Cliffs which is only a few blocks away.
author: Kathleen W.

description:
In responce to Trevor A.

I have know the owner of Asiento for 5 + yrs.  Working in nightlife for over 10 + yrs I can say she is one of the most honest, respected owners in the SF nightlife industry.  I also happen to know the bartender you are accusing of stealing your credit card.  First and fore-most she would never do that, therefore you are walking a fine line of defamation.  It is my understanding someone did pick up the phone and let you know your card (that you left behind!) was at the bar for you to pick up.  Let's think for a moment... If someone from Asiento "stole" your card why would they return it?  Why not tell you they did not have it?  If you took a moment to think about your mistake in leaving your card in the first place, you would have done what all of us have done when are card numbers have been stolen... Contact the bank and/or credit card company, have them to an investigation along with crediting you for charges you did not make.  Defaming a great bar and great bartenders because you have no life skills is just dumb.
author: Ali B.

description: Really tasty food. We came on a weekday, not too many servers, so it was a little slow. But really enjoyed all the drinks and apps!
author: Mary Y.

description: I have never wanted to, or have left a review, but this place is next level terrible in more ways than one.  My credit card was left there with a bartender/employee as an open bar tab (1 drink) and subsequently used by someone other than myself over the next 2 days at 6 different locations. As verified by my financial institution & fraud department. Took 3 days just to get in touch with someone at this location during business hours regarding this.  The owner was very unpleasant to deal with. Avoid this business.
author: Trevor A.

description:
Asiento is my jam. In addition to really great drinks (omg, Salted Punch) you can get
yummy brunch on a sunday morning, super tots and queso fundido in the afternoon. Tons of seating (hence the name) a bright sunny window and tons of board games. Bonnie, the bartender is amazing!
author: Nikki M.

description: Drink was strong and delicious. Vibe was clean without being too full of itself. I've been told that on some nights, they have a live DJ while people casually sit and sip (doesn't turn into a club). Five stars, would come again.
author: Leith M.

description: I love this neighborhood spot, which successfully does all things for all people. Industry folks and tech gals sit shoulder to shoulder on first dates, taco Tuesdays, whatever you wish. Show up hungry and you'll leave sated on one of SF's finest burgers, guac, ceviche and of course the aforementioned tacos. Debi the owner keeps one watchful eye on the proceedings and, her care for the venue and its patrons shines through. Say hello to bartender Moe for me who manages to perpetually put folks at ease and make them laugh while whipping up craft cocktails. Usually there's great music from DJs in the booth and never too loud. 5/5 for Asiento.
author: Steve K.

description: Cozy neighborhood bar. Games, good music, great cocktails. Owner is super nice and engaging as well.
author: Sonya O.

description: I love Asiento! It's been wonderful since Debi took over. The food is so delicious, my favorite dishes are 'The Gambas' and 'Tostadas De Tinga' but the truth is everything is so yummy and fresh. I used to live close by and go several times a week. The staff are all very sweet and the place has a lot of character, it's clean and unpretentious. One of my favorite places to sit at the bar, have a drink, some food and relax.
author: Michi R.

description:
Good selection of drinks and atmosphere, can't comment on the food (didn't have any), but I'm gonna knock off a star b/c the service was really intermittent. We were sitting right at the bar but had a lot of trouble flagging down the bartender (which switched several times) to even get refills or pay our bill.

Plus they have this weird policy about not taking credit cards (or something) but taking debit, but holding on to your credit card if you want to have a tab... So confusing and unnecessarily so.

I know merchants hate that they get charged all the feed for credit cards, but they undoubtedly make more from folks who can't really afford to be buying what they're buying, but use a credit card to stretch themselves, than they generally would going all cash. End rant.
author: Joshua B.

description:
Cash only and weak ass drinks. Got the Good Idea and the Basil Lemonade -- both were really weak. Even my girlfriend who usually is a lightweight thought so. :P

They have a dance floor though, so if you pregame beforehand, you can get down to some Latin American beats. I'd probably stick with drinking straight tequila next time. They've got a huge selection of straight booze. Just wish they actually used some in my drink.
author: Zi-on C.

description: Cute spot, nice and out of the way so it's not teeming with hipsteria. Had a cocktail and enjoyed the setting,  will definitely go back and try the tapas.
author: David C.

description: My roommate and I LOVE this place. I would selfishly rather not share how amazing this place is only because I like that it's a hidden gem and that we can get a seat in there most nights. But it's incredible so people really should know about this place. We love everything we've tried, both food and drink, and their service is unmatched. We come here on crazy bars nights and on quieter nights as well. We re trying to become regulars since we live so close!
author: Erica V.

description: I really, really wanted to love this spot since I live in the neighborhood. The space itself is adorable and inviting, and they have tapas as well as drinks. While this should be a winning combination, I have yet to finish any of the cocktails I've ordered there (I had a gin-based fruity drink, a basil lemonade drink, and something else that was bartender's choice) Each time the drink was too sweet and/or overpowered by the flavor of cheap alcohol. I'm not sure what recipes they were using, but after 3 tries I've quit. Stick to beer or wine, and maybe you'll be happier!
author: Jean L.

description:
I love their cocktails!

We we were bar hopping during the multi-cultural festival in Mission District and stopped by this place!  

Great bar, live DJ music, modern decor and they have their menu on box boards!  How hipster!
author: Tiffany D.

description: I was here for a conference sponsored brunch and I very much wanted to like this place but the service was abhorrent. Literally so understaffed for an event of approximately 100 people (capacity is 49 btw) and there was maybe 1 barback and 1 bartender for the whole function the entire time, in addition to 1 waitress/runner girl. Quite a shame that management didn't know how to handle the number of people who had pre-registered for this brunch. I waited 2 hours for my food and my friend waited around the same amount of time. Do better.
author: Morgen B.

description:
Cool bar. Came here in the middle of the day so it was pretty quiet. Ordered a peach/bourbon and though the bartender had never made one before, he made sure he got it perfect before serving it to me! He wanted to make sure it was just right and it sure was! Really appreciate that kind of service and professionalism.

Their tapas also looked quite tasty...
author: Christine E.

description:
this is a much more raucous and rowdy place o na Sunday afternoon than you would think. or maybe it just was the day I went. Going solo I sidled up to the bar for some late afternoon grub. 


Queso Fundido
5 cheese fondu served w/ house made chips & beef chorizo


Mixed Sausages
with mustard dipping sauce

Assorted Cheese And Salami Plate
house marinated olives & spiced nuts, grilled bread 

I soon found out this was way too much food and I was taking up a good amount of real estate at the bar. so much so that women around me were asking about my food. Bartender was awesome and she took good care of me. Not sure what to make of the crowd that is all over the place, but everyone was having fun. For a place kind of out there, it was hopping. I wonder what it's like on a Fri or Sat night?
author: Kim N.

description:
I came in here to experience Nuit Blance SF host by a guy named Ezra. 

1. Asiento's menu isn't the worst nor the best. It's medium priced & the portions are tiny. For example, the burgers are the size of White Castle ones. The staff are very attentive & kind but it's mostly just regulars who live nearby who come here. 


2. Nuit Blanche SF by Ezra was the sloppiest & most disappointing "networking event" anyone could ever go to: DON'T GO! The eventbrite ad promised free food & drinks, professionals in fashion, media, tech, biz & law, & a fab night. FACT: NONE OF THAT HAPPENED! No one knew of it, no seats, no bubblers nor grub & Ezra lacked the balls to tell my pal & I that he wasn't gonna foot the bill despite the eventbrite ad & even telling Asiento's staff! 

Conclusion: It felt like Ezra of NuitBlanche was just aiding the eatery by making a crappy false ad to get some folks in & to gain attention for himself. Tapsense & Highway hosts real networking events with real pros with skills, $$$$, manners & of course balls!
author: R C.

description: AMAZING DJ, Won Way. Horribly rude bartender, whateverhernameis. Her crappy attitude made it tough for us to relax and enjoy the night. But our DJ kept the booties popping. Thanks, Won Way!!
author: Amy Grace C.

description: This is a really awesome tapas bar. They have a wide range of liquor and wine. A small selection of draft beer, but those of high quality. Make sure to check out their board for specials. They usually have a "Kill the Bottle" $5 shot, which is both spontaneous and usually tasty. If you run out of things to talk about with your company, grab a game board and have fun!
author: Sarin P.

description: Probably the worst bar ever. $10 for a shot of Smirnoff. I will never come back. The staff is so rude as well.
author: Patrisha B.

description:
We ended up having our 10 year HS reunion here the day after Thanksgiving and I can honestly say Debbi saved the day!  We had no budget to work with in terms of "renting" a place out, but needed a space to accommodate 50-100 guests in a semi-private space for the event.  

Debbi was a dream to work with!  She totally understood our dilemma of not having any budget to "rent" the place out and said not to worry, because the crowd would be buying drinks and it was a win-win.  HUGE weight lifted off our planning shoulders.  In the end we were able to collect enough for a "food budget" and ordered food off the menu - which was all very good.  On the day of the event, as she noticed people were slowing down with the food -- she converted the food budget into a "shots" budget and we passed around free shots with the money we had leftover.  It was a great hit, and we owe it to her!

It's also just a great locals bar - Debbi is super chill and even allows dogs in the bar.  Really warm, welcoming atmosphere.  

Also, lots of yummy drinks.. my "go to" is the cucumber rosemary.. delicious!

THANK YOU so much for everything, Debbi!
author: Melody T.

description:
I believe asiento means seat in Spanish. There are seats inside here, so I guess my high school spanish is still as good as ever. Boom

Anyways, this is a quiet bar that is a great place to sit down and relax. We came here after visiting a sports bar during some college football games, so the environment here was definitely welcomed. They have a great bar and cocktail list, but I really  wished I didn't eat so much dinner because the menu here looked/sounded sooo good. They also offer board games which several of the groups here were playing.

So come in, order cocktail (yelp discount if you check in), and grab un asiento por favor.
author: Jay R.

description:
Found this gem on Yelp when I was trying to find something in the Mission district. We wanted a bar type setting where we can listen to music, get good food and maybe a drink or two afterwards. Asiento hit all marks. 

We ordered a few drinks and some tapas.  My friend had the basil lemonade and craft beer. The lemonade was sweet, and was not overloaded with alcohol. If you like it sweet you'll definitely like this. And for the food:

**Tinga Tostadas: Tasty. And quite filling. Very flavorful chicken, with a hint of spice.
**Queso fundido: yummy, gooey cheesy goodness with homemade chips. I would order this again.
**Bocadillo: These are like mini tortas. Tasty, and I suspect the chicken they use is similar or the same as the tinga tostadas
**Gamba. Four giant pieces of sautéed shrimp with crunchy bread slices. Delicious, the sauce it was cooked in was awesome. 

There was a DJ playing Saturday night, and he was mixing a good mash-up for old and new hip hop and pop music.  He was better than some club DJ's.  Besides parking being a huge pain in the ass, it was a great time and would definitely come out again.
author: Humberto G.

description: This place is good. They have good drinks and tapas. Happy hour is only for 1 hour. They are kind of expensive but a good spot to at least check out at least once. My two favorites would be the basil lemonade cocktail w vodka. Super good and have been making them at home! The tapas...the prawn gambas are the really tasty. Only three stars because of the 1 hr happy hour which makes no one happy and the cost $$. Blew 100$ an
author: Dan R.

description:
My friend was too hungry to work out so I forced him to do 15 minutes with me on the stairmaster at Mission Cliffs and off to Asiento we went. I had never even heard of this place but it is super cute! I think we went on trivia night and there were quite a bit of people there. 

I really love the ambiance. Its dark and nice while being warm and homey all at the same time. Its hard to pull that off! We didn't get any drinks although the cocktail menu looked fantastic. I rarely get carded at bars so I thought it was really weird they carded me especially since I was only ordering the food. Oh well! 

I got the shrimp rolls and my friend got the burger. I think the price point is wayyy too high for the food portions. My shrimp roll was pretty disappointing but his burger smelled really good, although it was pretty small. 

I would definitely come back here and give the tapas another chance. The menu just sounds so good and I love tapas! All the other reviews regarding the tapas are really warding me off though. Come on you guys, take the constructive criticism!!!
author: Tiffany V.

description:
Ever play Scrabble at the bar before, all while eating Thai Spring Rolls and swilling a Manhootan? Here, that's totally a possibility! Not to say boardgames are mandatory by any means (or even known about by all patrons), but that's one specialty here in the Mission. They're stored in the back, along the wall, behind some of the couch seating -- you can't miss 'em!

Their crab cakes with chipotlé cream sauce are also pretty good. Can be live DJ music, too. Enjoyable spot to end the night.
author: Garett T.

description: A nice little tapas bar tucked away in the mission. Ambience is always good and the mood is generally very chill. Service can be a little slow but that's why you go to melt away your cares of the day.
author: Dwight N.

description: A great neighborhood gem. I had our annual Christmas party there and Debi, the owner, was so gracious and accommodating. Great vibe and excellent food. The bartenders were fantastic and very helpful. A perfect neighborhood spot for any occasion.
author: Emilia G.

description:
Bit of a wait, but worth it for the drinks. Stopped by for some quick drinks on Saturday, ordered one each of the Cucumber Rosemary, The Good Idea, Summer Affair, and Basil Lemonade between the two of us and wow, what a nice variety of flavors and ingredients! Favorite of the night was probably The Good Idea (twist!), but there might be some bias there if you enjoy a gingery and refreshing drink as much as I do.

Bartenders were responsive and nice, though there was some confusion as we were in that zone between coverage by two different bartenders, as they served people around us. 

Fairly busy around 7pm, and a bit hard to find street parking around the bar. Would suggest riding together to get out to this area.
author: James K.

description:
I come here about once a month for a friend's DJ brunch (Check it out! The third Sunday of every month), so this is a review of the Recovery Brunch only. I will have to make an effort to come here on a weeknight, though now that I no longer live in the neighborhood, there's less chance of that happening.

Anyway, this is a great place to have a relaxing and very tasty brunch on the weekends. I've been here when it's packed and I've been here when it's fairly empty (minus our group) but I've always had an enjoyable experience. I must recommend the breakfast burrito (I get mine sans bacon) - they are seriously delicious. AND they come with tater tots. TOTS! I had forgotten how much I love them until I was kindly reminded by Asiento. I usually try to stay away from alcohol at brunch, however $5 mimosas are hard to pass up. They come in a variety of flavors, too.

Great food and drink. Great tunes and vibe. Great friends. Great service. And to top it all off - board games. What more is there to ask?
author: Allison B.

description:
Stopped in after Carnaval and I was probably 3 hours of drinking behind everyone else already on the dance floor, which was unfortunate because they were playing a great song I wanted to dance to, but just wasn't "there" yet. It's the 2nd time I'd been there, and the crowd really varies. The drinks are pricey but decent enough. The first time I was there it was super crowded, multiple birthdays were going on, and I think someone got engaged or something -- At Asiento... I think..  

So this is where all the asian hipster boys are hiding... oheyy
author: Donna H.

description:
I was scrambling to find a bar with trivia on Mondays, which lead me to Asiento.  I had never noticed this place before, even though I passed it many times on the way to Mission Cliffs, but I'm glad I found it.

Trivia starts at 8:30, and we were done before 11.  I get bored waiting between rounds, so I was happy that everything moved at a good pace.  The ceviche, guacamole, cheese dip and bocadillos were all pretty good, and a nice change from all fried bar foods.  Portion sizes are small for the price, but not outrageous.

No one was particularly happy with their cocktails, and the beer that my friend ordered was not cold, but I'm game to try other drinks.
author: Seong P.

description:
Great food, mature crowd, top notch sound system, fun decor.

House cocktails are pretty weak though.
author: Troy S.

description:
This place could have come straight from the set of "Friends": everything is cozy, there are board games, you can get "trendy" tapas and drinks. It's almost so much so that as a whole, I can't figure out the bar's character. It's certainly a far cry from the bar that was here previously (Monkey's I think).
Anyway, I only come here for Monday's trivia quiz. The quiz itself is annoyingly USA-centric, so don't even think about playing it without an American sports or pop culture guru in your group. It is unfortunate, as San Francisco is an international city. Thankfully, there are plenty of other quizzes in the city.
Food and drinks are both overpriced. I would have beer here and skip their cocktails. As fancy as some of them sound, they have been kind of weak on alcohol. And food is, well, small in portions. It is a well-known fact that the tapas trend is the best thing that happened to restaurant owners in America. Charge full price for tiny dish and... ka-ching! Which misses the whole concept of tapas. Anyway, overall Asiento is not a bad bar, just not a great one, either.
author: Evg R.

description:
Asiento is a bar that just makes you feel like you are going for a drink a your best friends place. Its such a welcoming and chill environment that you always want to come back if you are in the area. They have a great selection of drinks and the bartenders are very knowledgeable. The drinks have a lot of tequila elements to them but there is a variety I especially liked the Prickly Pear Margarita. They also have a great selection of tapas and other small plates that you will probably need to order around four to five of to fill up but they are all delicious so it is worth the investment especially if you come with a few people to split the cost. 

The crowd is so much fun, everyone seems to be having a good time and there aren't a lot of pretentious people or the feel of the Marina crowd you can get in other places. Asiento is snuggled between a bunch of residential houses and off the beaten path of the mission area so it feels like an undiscovered find when you stumble upon it. The staff was really nice including the owner who came out and chatted with customers and made sure everyone had a good time. They also provide games on Wednesday night to encourage people to mingle and interact. They also have several themed dance nights and I have gone on a full-fledged 80's night which was incredible and I believe the bartenders danced more that we did!

There is a nice selection of wine for those who prefer that as well. The only issue is that it can get crowded here as a lot of larger groups stop by for the tapas so it can be hard to find a seat at times and it can get very loud when it reaches this point so it can be hard to hear the person you are with over them and the music. Great date spot as the mood is set as soon as you walk in. Also don't forget to pay in cash! Debit is only really good if you are opening a large tab.

Overall though it is a great spot to check out and make yourself a regular. The staff will recognize you and you will wow your friends with your knowledge of local treasures like this one. Hope its around for a long time because SF needs more bars that have gotten over themselves and being cool and are actually cool because they provide excellent service.
author: Nick R.

description: I used to really like this place, but after tonight will not be returning. This place profiles its clients based on how they look/ what they are wearing and it is not okay! Tonight, after over an hour of being there, a pleasant chat with the bartender about drink recipes, and buying our whole group a couple of rounds of drinks, a good friend of mine was told he had to remove his SF Giants hat because the cameras could not capture his face. When we asked why this was suddenly an issue, they said that it fit the description of people who stole a purse in the past, so he had to remove his hat if he wanted to stay in the bar. A Mission district native was being judged based on his appearance a block way from where he grew up. This is unfair profiling and cannot continue in our community! Asiento, you should be ashamed of yourself! DO NOT SUPPORT THIS BAR AND ITS PREJUDICE PRACTICES!
author: Vanessa S.

description:
Several reviewers say Asiento has good cocktails -- I guess that's if you like them on the sweet side...  Their cocktails are $8.50 each, but expect only yummy girly drinks that are not perfectly balanced and are pretty one dimensional.  My 'Manhootan' was oddly sweet - I'm guessing they either used the honey flavored Jack or were too heavy handed with the aperol.  The gin-based 'Tannenbaum' was really sweet and tasted more like an uncarbonated mojito.  The 'Hummingbird' (tequila+grapefruit) was probably the best drink at our table simple because it was the least sweet.  

Overall, not impressed with the drinks.  Maybe my standards were too high since I just went to Rickhouse earlier this week.  I think my favorite part of Asiento was the board games.
author: Beatrice W.

description:
I love Asiento. The ambiance, the crowd, the cocktails, the service...just great!

This review is purely based on Asiento as a bar, and not the restaurant (Although I really want to try the Tapas because I have heard they are superb!). The cocktails which the bar doles out are high quality, and properly made. I really appreciate a properly made cocktail, so if you're like me, you'll love what you get. 

If your on a date in the Mission, I don't know if there is a better place to take your lady friend. 

Not only is this place a gem in the deep mission, but the staff is also extremely friendly and helpful. My friends and I were even allowed to throw a small fundraiser for our Burning Man camp.

Hats off to Asiento and its staff. Well done, I'll be back, for certain.
author: Aunik B.

description:
Asiento is so wonderful!

I came in with some friends for a quick happy hour and ended up staying for a few hours. The service is great, the food is wonderful for a bar and its in such a great neighborhood. I didn't realize there we're so many great spots in this area.

Debbie is fabulous. Her hospitality and her personality will make you wanna come back for more.
author: Reina T.

description:
We came for tapas and the cocktails. 
The cocktails were experimental but not tastey. 
The food was given to a table of fat ladies who didn't order it. An hour later when we did get what we ordered it was a great let down; like the 49ers this year.
author: Peter O.

description: What a great little bar/hangout/delish food/music venue this is! Came here for a birthday party in December and it was sooo much fun. There was a house DJ playing music, tables full of people sitting and standing, and dancing on the quasi dance floor in the back of the venue. Cocktails were excellent as were the lovely bartenders. This place gets pretty packed and understand my so. One last thing, try the guacamole and chips! They are one of the BEST (imho) along the Mission district and that's saying a lot!!
author: Ny H.

description:
Review solely for the bar.

This is a great place to hang out. The bartender is super nice and would offer suggestions, and they have some good cocktails (on the sweet/girly side) for you to start with. They also carry No. 209 gin and Hangar One vodka, which is always a plus in my books :)

They also have board games in the back if you like to challenge your friend to a game.
author: Alice C.

description: Nice spot, recently went here with some friends.  Bar tenders are very friendly and knowledgeable about their drinks.  I learned a lot about gin and vodka :P
author: Charles V.

description:
"love their seats"

This bar is great - loud enough to be fun, not so loud you cant hear yourself think, featuring a good selection of beer, wine, and specialty cocktails. Its friendly and relaxed vibe is enough to set it apart and above most local competition. Looking forward to going back.
author: Oleg H.

description: This is one of our fav go-to places. It's great to stop in and grab some shared bites and awesome drinks.It never disappoints. We also love the atmosphere and chill music!
author: Samantha C.

description:
DRINKS ONLY.

Tequila thyme which was a little too herby for my taste but was pretty good but a little bland. My friends got the basil lemonade which was a large portion and tasted delish. We had just eaten but the tapas menu made me hungry all over again. Would love to come back and try them. Bartenders were attentive and check in to yelp for $1 or so off!
author: Irene S.

description:
I like this place a lot!
The tapas are amazing ( You have to try the ceviche!!!), the drinks are great and their wine is good enough.

I really like the atmosphere of this place, its great to go with some friends to sit down, drink, eat and chat.

Its one of the most interesting bars in the Mission for sure and the prices are really affordable.

My only complaint is: the bartenders are very friendly and nice but they are not very prompt. They take just foreeeeever to talk to you and definitely don't pay a lot of attention if you are waiting for them to approach or not.

Also, the DJ- even though he plays some really good songs-   interrupts the songs all the time and keep talking, when he could just shut up for a little bit and play some good music. 

But still, this place is worth a visit for sure! You will not regret!!!
author: Paula C.

description:
It's my neighborhood bar!  Super close to my apartment.

I went there for brunch and had a pulled pork sandwich.  The meat was very very tender.  My partner had a chilaquiles.  Delightful.  I've had other food there, but it's usually hit or miss.

They have an good selection of liquor and some very nice specialty cocktails and wines.  The on-tap beer selection is limited, though they pick a few quality brews like Scrimshaw.

They often have special events (e.g., Star Wars night), but it's never too loud to have a conversation.  Overall, not a bad place to have a drink.
author: Michael N.

description:
Food good (what gets them a 2nd star).   They enforce a bullshit dress code to appease the crowd. I will choose to drop a couple hundred dollars elsewhere (let alone the $2k+ my group of 15 spent) where I can wear whatever I feel.    I sat in this place for hours before my appearance was noted and brought to my attention. I am beyond well paid (meaning not a neighborhood drunk if it's a gentrification issue) but I refuse to dress up. I have been made to feel like I don't belong here. 

Bar tenders WILL question you if you tip low on credit card transactions despite tipping cash.   Very tacky.

Debi C, say what you will, we simply won't do business again.
author: Craig T.

description:
Asiento is my favorite non-dive bar in the Mission. The prices are mid-range, the food is way above standard bar fare and the vibe is damn good.

Details Below...

One: Asiento fits this perfect middle spot between the excruciatingly expensive, trendy night spots that give that "you're not hip or rich enough to be standing nuts to butts in here" and the full-on, yelling-prone halls of shit-shot-and-a-beer chaos. Let me say, however, so you know where I'm coming from, that I'm the kind of guy who prefers the loud, drunk dive over the mixologist bullshit every time I'm not with a beautiful woman, which is to say almost every time. I'd normally lean towards the grungier crowd but this place is great in so many ways that I find myself here often. 

Two: They have real food. One of my favorite burgers in the city is their Juicy Burger. It's small size and few ingredients are assets rather than drawbacks; the thing is just good in savory, salty and creamy (the mayo makes it) ways. The Queso Fundido is as rich and deadly as it is in Mexico, the guacamole is better than average, and their assorted tapas plates are great for sharing.

Three: I've had nothing but good experiences with the staff here. From coming by myself for dinner and a drink to bringing a cadre of friends for a full night of food, drink, dancing and revelry, the bartenders and especially the owner Debi have made my experience overwhelmingly positive. Being a regular here has also translated into privileges and personal treatment (remembering my drink, foods, and even bar hopping with them after closing some nights).

Miscellaneous appreciation: 

They accept Debit (not Credit) cards so it's a step above cash only.

Here There Be Burners - it's not central to the bar but there's a real radical inclusion feel to this place.

Local talent. Art shows on the walls / Bay Area DJs / board game and trivia location. Makes for a cool visual/auditory  environment. Less hard rock and more soul. Sometimes lighter electronic music.

Extra large open windows provide a view of Bryant St and allow natural light to flood  bar during the day.

Decent brunch options although it is a bar brunch not restaurant brunch with mimosas thrown on. The few times I've done brunch that's exactly what I wanted: full-bar-brunch really shakes things up. Burbon and bacon!

Many vegetarian options, a gluten-free bread option.

I've seen lots of events here and attended two.

One issue: Pricing is very reasonable for most items although once in a while you can feel like you're paying too much for something. Guacamole and chips for $9 is kind of steep given that you can get one of the best burgers in five neighborhoods for $8. Once you know what the best things are you'll do great (get that damn burger and you won't care for a second). 

Come in and don't be shy. I'm the guy writing at the bar with the red sangria.
author: Sean K.

description:
There's a lot of things to like about Asiento: they play an eclectic, but good mix of music at a reasoanble volume. They have a number of comfortable places to sit. They have, if not amazing, at least solid "good" cocktails, and a tasty tapas style food menu. All good things. 

What makes Asiento a "must visit" however... is the burger. The $8 "Juicy Burger" is made with onion, soy sauce, and jalapeno, and served on an english muffin with spinach and mayo. And it. Is. amazing. Going here without trying it would just be a silly thing to do*. You're welcome.

*Unless you're a vegetarian. Sorry about that!
author: Brett W.

description:
I spent the first half hour thinking we were on our way to Losiento. People kept saying you're sorry for what? That night (well that night is alcohol foggy) so today, I learned that Lo siento literally means "I feel it", but it is the Spanish phrase used to mean "I'm sorry". 

I also learned that Asiento (which loosely means "have a seat") is a pretty cool place to wait for your flour + water table. Its another dusty rustic bar that has a Yelp check in special. 

Its saving grace is the Bitten Cherry. Oooh, so tasty and sweet. The Basil Lemonade is not bad either. I spied some folk with the chorizo queso fundido at the bar. It looked and smelled delicious. I halfway wish we'd ordered it because we still had to wait another hour for our table at flour + water...

Lo siento Asiento. You're a-ok with me.
author: Kelly G.

description:
First impressions lie. That is the gist of my Asiento story. 

The first time I went here was for a nightcap after a long night of drinking. My friends and I were driving around and popped into the first bar we saw. It was last call and the place looked pretty depressing  -- dark, quiet, and empty except for a few stragglers at the bar. A very forgettable experience. 

Thanks to another random nightcap a few months later, we happened on this place again, and it was a completely different experience. 

Subdued lighting bathed everything in a warm glow. This time, I noticed the spacious seating area, the comfortable leather chairs, and the DJ dishing out the disco. I didn't want to mix my liquors and already started the evening out with wine, so I wasn't able to sample the cocktails. What really got me was their tapas menu. Delicious!

Queso Fundido with Chorizo - Traditionally served with Oaxacan cheese, Asiento's version uses five different cheeses for extra richness and flavor. It's hot, ooey gooey, cheesaliciousness mixed up with ground chorizo that comes with some chips for dipping. Sooo good. 

Gambas -- Plump, fresh shrimp cooked up in garlic, olive oil served with slices of bread (perfect for mopping up the plate). It was really good, but I was a little disappointed that it only had four pieces of shrimp. That seemed rather stingy to me, even if it was tapas.

Calamares -- The squid was really fresh and soft, cooked in a mild sauce and served with bread. Also very good and although it was just as small a portion as the gambas, it wasn't as glaring because of the way it was served. 

Mixed Sausages -- Assorted sliced sausages with a mustard dip was pretty much what it said it would be. I'm not sure what sausages they used though.

Everything we ordered was a hit. We enjoyed our drinks, the service was great, the music was great. Asiento had a fun, energetic, non-pretentious vibe that I really connected with. I'm so glad we gave this place another chance or I would have completely missed out on this awesome neighborhood spot.
author: Racquel N.

description:
Wow. This place is so.much.fun.

A cool neighbourhood bar, with a wide open space, and large windows lined along the whole place. It has a cozy and warm atmosphere, with high top tables, and couches near the back of the room. If I lived in SF, I'm sure this would be one of the places that I'd be frequenting.

We came here on a Friday night around 11pm and it wasn't too busy so we were able to get our own table.  They have a simple cocktail list, with 8 cocktails, and a cocktail of the day, a mango mojito. I got a cucumber-rosemary cocktail with rosemary syrup, cucumber and vodka. 

As the friendly bartender mixed up our drinks, we headed to the back of the room to check out their board game selection. We were notified that Jenga was missing many of its pieces, so we settled on Scrabble and Blokus instead. 

The next two hours was spent playing Blokus, a game of strategy and some luck, while sipping on our delicious cocktails. It was a great night indeed. 

With a Yelp check in offer for a $6 cocktail, this only heightened the awesomeness of the whole night.
author: Vincci L.

description: Awesome neighborhood bar with tasty tapas, original cocktails (not to mention clever drink names), board games, lounge-y music, comfy couches and chill af bartenders. What more could you ask for??
author: Jennifer L.

description:
I was there last week for drinks with friends, my friend ordered a margarita and she got a well made with mint ( have you seen a mojito without it ?) and the bartender took her time to prepared it and so on. The mojito was very good which made me to order the same .... two seconds after she gave me my order, a plain cup with ice and a weird liquid inside, I asked her what it was and she said "mojito" .... but where is the mint ? Where is the shaking thing ? Where is the taste ? The bartender took my glass with no manners, got two leaves of mint threw inside my glass and with less manners then before slammed the glass in front of me.
