Result: no tips for a bad service ... no tips ? Surprise surprise, When I went to check my bank statement I noticed they changed my bill adding 25% tip without my consent ... as I understand this is fraud isn't it ?
author: Jaime P.

description: My husband and I came here with two of our friends as a last hurrah before the baby arrives. The place is more of a bar for drinks and not food, but we actually liked that it was more laid-back and not over-crowded. This may also be because we showed up at 6 pm on a Sunday. We ordered quite a bit of tapas since we were all hungry, but some of the ones that really stood out were the Deviled Eggs, Queso, Bocadillos, Juicy Burger, spinach balls and beet salad. I really enjoyed the deviled eggs and carnita bocadillos, so much so that I ordered seconds and thirds (yes, I'm pregnant and have no shame).  My husband loved the burger - raving about how juicy and tender it was. The server who brought our food was really prompt and friendly. I highly recommend checking this place out. Tip: Cash Only!
author: Kim C.

description:
Stopped here for the first time w/ friends before checking out the ShEvil Dead all-girl zombie production @ Cellspace. My friend picked this place because it serves drinks + food. The tapas plates were small (insert "duh" here) but they were pretty good as far as bar snacks go. Gambas, crab cakes and guacamole all received thumbs up from the table.

The 5 stars over 4 stars rating is because Debbi (sp?), the proprietor of this establishment, served us and the service was memorable. FYI--there is table service when it's not so busy but when it picks up later, you should order at the bar. This place has a chill, comfortable, fun and dare I say slightly edgy ambiance. For drinks, we had the basil lemonade, bitten cherry, punch (all sort of sweet) but 5 stars for the Debbi's willingness to create a pisco sour. Would definitely come back.

I'm kind of a fan of the building's odd paint job, which appears to be an homage to outer space/haight-ashbury/the third eye but notably, the inside is unexpectedly modern.
author: Madam Y.

description:
I'm not sure what they hype is about this place. I stopped by for Yelp Drink Week yesterday and when I walked in, it was COMPLETELY empty. I thought that was so bizarre, being 7PM and all. 

My friend and I ordered the Cucumber Rosemary and Basil Lemonade. The bartender took about 5 minutes making EACH drink. The basil lemonade was good but a bit watered down. THe cucumber rosemary had a good cucumber taste. We also ordered the Lemon Hummus ($6) which came with a large portion of hummus and only 7 small pieces of bread. The hummus was really good but we ran out of bread so fast and they charge $3.00 for more!!!! Seriously?! Can you say CHEAP?

My biggest concern with this place is that they charge a $20 minimum for DEBIT CARDS. I know for a FACT that restaurants are NOT allowed to charge a minimum of over $10, and nothing at all for debit transactions. My friend and I were discussing that in FRONT of the bartender and he STILL said there was a minimum. 
http://usa.visa.com/about_visa/ask_visa/index.html#anchor_4

Overall, definitely pass this place, even for Yelp Drink Week. If you don't take my word for it, take the word of the 20-30 possible patrons that also decided to go somewhere else yesterday.
author: Stephanie L.

description:
Upscale neighborhood bar that has a nice casual bar and a decent small food menu. The prices for the food are 1-3 dollar more than what they should be but are in keeping with SF and hipster Mission food prices.

The virgin cocktails were good and the food came out quick. Although they are called tapas and even have the same names the dishes here are more South American than Spanish. Everything had more spice and zing in it than you would find in Spain. The gambas were good although there were only 4, The veggie bocodillas were good as was the shrimp ceviche both of which had a spicy remoulade sauce. The spring rolls were tiny and too sweet for my taste.

4 tapas and two drinks came to 38 dollar so it's a reasonable place to get a light meal and drinks. The space is nice with sound baffling panel, have only been there early in the evening when there wasn't many people. Seating is limited to a few bar height tables and some small seating areas with arm chairs and the bar.Wheelchair accessible.
author: DeathandFood H.

description:
Great local spot with good music and an interesting brunch of non pretentious hipster or CEO.
Upon walking in, I realized I've visited this establishment years ago... At that time nothing stood out. But this time around, the food, the music, and the drinks will sure make this a regular spot( if it wasn't so far from where I live). 
Food:
Crab cake- 5 stars
Good prices and you taste the sweetness and freshness of the crab
Shrimp ceviche- 5 stars
The veggies in the line juice is fresh and crunchy and the shrimp is simply fresh
Burger- 5 stars
Those little things are the devil- must get it
Shrimp( grill)- 4.5 stars
Only because it's like 2 dollars a shrimp and I wish it came with more sauce for the bread
Guacamole and chips-4.5 stars
Again need more guacamole for the chips.

5 tapas size dish and 2 drinks +tips for a whooping $64. I know it's expensive for other cities, but in sf that's a win!!!!
author: jasmin t.

description: What an awesome gem. This unsuspecting bar has an incredibly friendly crowd and staff.  A great neighborhood spot. Tapas style food. The chicken meatballs and kebabs were delicious.  Great chill place to host a group of friends.
author: Matt J.

description:
I was puzzled as to why someone would name a bar "Chair." Then again, Palo Alto means "tall stick", so I guess it's a California thing. Anyway, we came in and they indeed had chairs - comfy ones. It wasn't crowded, which was highly unusual (and a pleasant surprise) for a Mission neighborhood bar on a Friday night. 

I had some kind of cucumber drink that I wasn't in love with, but my friend had a very tasty citrus one. I realize I sound like an idiot because I don't remember the names. It was nice to have a drink and enjoy some conversation WITHOUT SHOUTING AT ONE ANOTHER. The end.
author: Selina K.

description:
I came here for my friend's birthday. I was having an absolute blast at Asiento tonight, the bartenders were quick, friendly and on point. All the patrons there we're also friendly and vibin'. I was really loving the place until the terrible rapper/DJ/whatever that is came on.

Now, the guy wasn't a terrible rapper, at all. I actually thought he was pretty good. One of the last places I want to hear rap music in on 10:00 on a Friday while I'm talking to my friends and enjoying the environment. Not that I don't dig some underground rap but let's be honest, if music is preventing us from having conversation it better be encouraging us to move our behinds. And it wasn't making me want to move my behind anywhere except out of that place.

If the place going from packed to nearly empty wasn't a sign that you shouldn't bring live music back. Then I'm thinking maybe you prefer your place pretty empty, I don't know. 

Once again, dude had talent but I just didn't go to Asiento on a Friday for live music. 

I'd love to come back here when there's no obnoxiously loud music and give this place a higher review!
author: Matt L.

description: Chill fun atmosphere.  Drinks are on point!  The nibbles were delish!  This is a great neighborhood gem!
author: sam m.

description:
I always have a good time here.  The wine list is good, and the service is great.  Debi has never been anything other than a gracious host.  And the food is good, too. 
I live a few blocks away, and am happy to call this my neighborhood bar.  If you're going to trivia- get there early, because it seems that big groups come right near start time, so it's good to stake out your place in advance.  Thanks Asiento!
author: Maria L.

description: Great cocktails, friendly staff, breezy seating! Their food is a little pricey for the portion size, but really worth trying.
author: Marisa G.

description:
The space is neat, there are board games, and the coffee was drinkable (1 star). The staff seems nice, but inattentive.  Our server never asked how our food was, and I imagine she didn't ask because she knew it was bad.

Brunch is terrible... ludicrously terrible. The food and drinks were the wrong color for Pete's sake. The bloody mary was brown and tasted like an old steak. The "hollandaise" sauce was hideously orange. Why it was orange, I do not know, because it tasted like lumpy, greasy lemonade. The tater tots had no seasoning at all and were hard and greasy.

Until today, I've never actually been disgusted by breakfast food before.
author: Kristen K.

description:
I love Asiento!!
My sister and I go there for brunch and often blow off the rest of our plans for the day because really, why leave?
and then I had my birthday party there. Asiento is definitely all about enabling a good party!! I was pretty stoked on my birthday drink special:)
Deb, the owner, rocks. Shes fun and gets things done!
also, the food is yum.
author: Michelle W.

description: Yummy tapas- filling and flavorful. Great vibe. Monday night trivia. Super delicious cocktails with fresh ingredients!! Highly recommend it!!
author: Tala A.

description:
Love this bar! One of the few bars I've found in the city with good food. Friendly for carnivores and vegetarians, with even vegan and gluten-free options. As a vegetarian, I can't even sit next to the juicy burger, it smells so good. I love the guac and queso when I'm feeling indulgent. Cocktail menu is great and large wine selection.

Barteders and owner are very friendly and attentive. Atmosphere is wonderfully cozy. Come for trivia on Monday, game night on Wednesday (or any time really), and brunch on Sunday is sooo yummy. It's a really great place on a sunny day with the big windows. DJs and other events are often happening, then other times it's the perfect quiet atmosphere to have a meeting or conversation.
author: Sara P.

description:
This is a neat place to have in the neighborhood -- it's a step up in class from JayBee's around the corner with its fancypants cocktails, wood panels, and even a live DJ. The owner is really nice (she was introducing herself, going around tables, and offering everybody brownies). All in all, I really like the ambiance of the bar. Although it hasn't really been discovered yet, it was still pretty hopping (considering its location in the Mission) for a Friday night. Every seat was filled, but you didn't have to deal with any standing crowds, which was nice.

A couple of things though -- drinks here are pretttty expensive. A tumbler of neat Jameson was $7 (it's $5 around the corner at JayBee's) and well drinks are $6. Pretty bad for the Mission, especially this far east. The seating arrangement is also kind of awkward. My party lucked out with getting seats at the long table, but I noticed that immediately behind us were wooden benches along the wall. Were people supposed to sit on those, directly behind the tall tables? Bah.

All in all though, a pretty pleasant experience. I'd come back. I wish this business good luck and hope it makes it!
author: Michelle L.

description:
I have been a few times, and it's now time to leave a review, since I have thoroughly enjoyed my experience, and the food, each time I've been.  

I should quantify this review by saying, every time I've been in, -- since I don't live in the neighborhood -- it's been with friends who do, and they know the establishment and the staff fairly well.  I really enjoy their drink selection (fun to see all these different herbs, etc at the bar, at the ready to make some really cool mixed drinks) and I like their wine list as well.  Last time I was in, I had the guacamole and chips (homemade and so dellish) and the burger.  The burger is small (I didn't want a huge entrée and because my friend said it was served on English muffins, I realized that would be perfect) and is verrrry flavorful.  The food took a wee bit longer to get to us, than I thought it would, but considering it's all made to order, I chilled on that, and just enjoyed my drink, my friends company and the great music. (Love the DJ).  Cheers!  I will be back!  :-)  Nicole
author: Nicole O.

description: THIS PLACE IS DA BOMB.COM. I came here on a Friday with the intention of getting happy hour with friends but I'm not actually sure if we made it to their happy hours since there weren't any deals really. The specialty cocktails are $9.50. My favorite was the good idea which was a gin based drink. It smells like a delicious citrus concoction. Yes I sniffed my drink and yes it was alcoholic. So in hindsight if it did smell alcoholic it would have been a terrible idea to sniff it but thankfully it smelled glorious. We also ordered a lot of different tapas. My favorites were the sausages and the ceviche...also the shrimp. They're all decently portioned and great for sharing amongst friends. Definitely more than just your typical bar food. They also have board games. #win. They have drenga (drinking jenga). The clever fools marked a bunch of the blocks with "buy a round of drinks" so we kept having to buy rounds for everyone. We also included the stipulation that if you knocked over the jenga tower you had to buy a round. So let's just say everyone got sufficiently drunk. Also $45 for 5 kamikazes.... expensive but its sf so its expected. This bar is great.
author: Amy T.

description: Decently priced cocktail.  Nice ambiance with a dj playing music.  Bartenders seem nice as well.  No straws though... whats up with that?
author: Gary K.

description:
Fun little casual bar hidden on the quiet end of the Mission.

Friendly corner bar for regular gathering, generous portions of tapas as bar food.
The service was pretty fast considering how busy they get.
Love the ottomans and stools layout for more flexible seating,
as well as the board games to keep groups entertained.

The owner came by a few times and checked in on us,
she seemed to genuinely care and was really nice.
I think Asiento wants to be your go-to downstairs bar, and is really well set up for that.
With a varied menu and different activities every night, I'm definitely intrigued
to come by more often and pop in on Monday Trivia Night.
Music isn't overly loud, but more like background noise, so you can still
have a conversation without losing your voice.

Parking isn't that bad if you're willing to walk a couple of blocks,
definitely easier than your Mission/Valencia alternative, but it's a heavily
residential area, so it's still not very easy, especially at night.
author: Jade T.

description:
Love it. Was here last night for the third time. It has an easy, neighborhood vibe ( I live 4 blocks away) with great drinks and small plates. I have had most things on the menu, my favorites are the guacamole, tacos and the sliders and the pom sparkler to sip. Delicious. The owner is often there and she is funny,  efficient and no non sense.

 I recommend it for a first date drink too. 

**I would suggest less salt on the otherwise fresh and delicious Spinach salad though. Ouf, It's salty.
author: Uda W.

description: Great cocktails and an awesome DJ spinning completes a Sunday Funday!
author: Lisa L.

description:
My neighborhood weekday go-to bar when I'm feeling lazy and don't want to venture too far from my home. Definitely not the best cocktails I've had, but bartenders are nice and they have games you can play while you sip on your drinks. 

Taco Tuesday specials. 

If you're the first customer of the night, you get to call the happy hour drink special!
author: Hannah N.

description:
If you ask for a straw, they'll hand you a red vine instead since they're a green bar. Good drinks, low key vibe, and they've got an assortment of board games. Also, don't forget to check-in via yelp to get $2.50 of your cocktail. Solid choice for a bar when I'm in the neighborhood. 

When i was there this past weekend, there was a pop-up called pickpockets selling an italian version of an empanada. didn't try but maybe next time!
author: Susan C.

description:
3.5 Stars!

If you love board games, you must come here! This bar has cabinets filled with board games, which makes it a great destination for get togethers. They have games like Jenga, Spot It, Catch Phrase, etc. I had a great time! :)

However, the bartenders are very slow when it comes to ordering drinks and tapas. Drinks are decently priced, and it's only $6 if you check in on Yelp - but the mojito was NOT good. BF loved the long island though. The food was decent, but pricey for what it is. The bartender actually gave the food I ordered to another table, and I had to approach her to ask why it was taking so long... 

Overall, would definitely come again!
author: Michelle L.

description: Pine St ale and spinach balls on a slow, chill evening. With the Gumby family. Pleasant.
author: Maximillian M.

description:
Taco Tuesdays! I've only been here during Taco Tuesdays, as my husband spins a few times a month here. Tacos are $2 and excellent (apparently the shrimp tacos are delish, but I'm allergic to shrimp so can't vouch for that myself).  The beers are reasonably priced, and they have a decent selection on tap (my fav is the Scrimshaw).  For food, I like the guac, the queso fundido, and the bocadillos. If you like house tunes you should definitely come check out the music, too.

What's cool about this place is the crowd changes over the course of the night, and it might look like its dead at 6:30 but then a whole new group of people show up. You get a few folks in for happy hour, a few folks in later around 7-8, and then a later night crowd, as well. I love how chill the atmosphere is, and it feels like a neighborhood joint the way people gather.   

Bonnie usually tends bar Tuesday night and she is awesome - really easy to talk to and makes great drinks. 

Going out on a Tuesday night can be a hard sell for me, but this is a nice, relaxing atmosphere to listen to tunes, drink some beers, and eat some tacos.
author: Anne O.

description: Ok place.  Didn't feel the vibe and the food wasn't that great.  OK selection of beers but their drinks could be stronger.
author: Kao S.

description: Had a really nice time here on a Friday night with my fiancé. They have a lot of board games, and we played cards while sitting at the bar. Super kick back, neighborhood vibe. Yummy tapas and the bartender made wonderful drinks. They also had a DJ who was playing chill beats... Cool art too!
author: Lillian S.

description:
Ended up here for our 3rd drink of the night before heading home, a bar hoping night in the Mish if you will.  GREAT BAR!  The owner or manager was very friendly and talkative.  The speciallty drinks we ordered were both Ah-Maze-Ing.... I got the Cucumber Rosemary drink and my honey got the "A good Idea" and they were both amazing.  I am looking forward to trying brunch here.  

So glad I can walk here easily and enjoy a great drink, a glass of wine, or some tapas.

Great find in the Mish
author: Nicole W.

description: Came here on a Saturday night and it was surprisingly empty, but worked out for us because we wanted a place to sit and chat. I got the Hummingbird drink and replaced reposado with a mezcal, which everyone agreed made the drink taste better. Was also able to use my yelp check in for $2.00 off a specialty cocktail. I would recommend this place for a quiet night out with good cocktail drinks.
author: Lisa T.

description:
After work for drinks led me here. Funny, that all I wanted to find at Asiento was an 'asiento', real bad. Limited seating--for those of you who don't "eh-speak eh-Spanish".

Inside this small place were what looked like mostly regulars sitting around. Bar was nicely stocked and I agree with a few other reviewers that drinks sure did take a while to get made (and they're kinda small for almost $9).

Dj was playing some cool retro music for a while (which made up for lack of seating). THEN techno/mix person took over the music booth. I downed my Manhattan and split. 

**props to the mixologist, the drinks were tasty...! I tasted their hummingbird and Manhattan (spelled funny, made with a twist).
author: Hilda Z.

description:
Tacos we're so great, but 3.50 for one piece of shrimp not so much. Also the waitress was not so nice, and as much as I tried to smile back. But, maybe she was just having a bad day or her delivery to us was meant to be kind but came out rudely? 

Good music and good crowd.
author: Jemma L.

description: Logan was amazing. Kept our spirit up the whole night, especially on a Sunday night. The food was amazing. Everything taste really really good. The good came very timely. We ordered a few things at a time.
author: Janine Z.

description: I'm basically drooling thinking of these mouthwatering burgers they serve. They go well with basically any of the cocktails, especially the fruity Tequila Thyme.
author: Nicolas G.

description:
Met up with a friend for after-work drinks and a light bite. There were only two people sitting at the bar, so we wandered up and ordered some beers and two appetizer plates: crab cakes (pretty good!) and thai spring rolls (OH MY GOD so zesty and delicious!) After that, we were still hungry so we ordered albondigas (serious yum) and another tray of the spring rolls, which we wolfed down. At this point, we were feeling downright gluttonous, so we got the spinach burger and yet another tray of spring rolls. I cannot stress how delicious those things were. I want them all the time.

The place filled up slowly throughout our leisurely meal, but service did not falter. We went up to the bar to order more and everything was brought right to our table and the empty plates were whisked away at just the right moment.

The ambiance is super chill. Chairs are mismatched, tables are glorified wooden crates. It was dark inside because they had a blackout curtain over the door. It worked, though, because my friend had just got her pupils dilated at the doctor so this way she didn't have to wear sunglasses in the bar like some punk.

We left at 8:15, totally oblivious to the fact that Monday night trivia starts at 8:30! Guess this means I'll have to go back. And have those spring rolls again oh my god.
author: Lia S.

description:
Asiento has personality in its food and people! My friend took me here for lunch and we had mango mimosas, eggs benedict with crab, and chilaquiles. The chilaquiles and mimosas were good, but the eggs benedict with that special sauce was amazing!

I also liked the decor and overall ambiance; the leather seats and natural wood nicely contrasted with the colorful artwork and the dj was spinning good lounge music. The service at Asiento was equally as impressive. We were greeted as soon as we walked in and the waitress was attentive. Even the owner checked-in with us and sat down for a quick chat!  Great place overall and highly memorable. I'll definitely come back.
author: I Z.

description:
I love Asiento for several reasons:

1. It's a local bar with a fancy touch- not enough to alienate the neighbors but enough to draw folks in from far away.  

2. They have a carefully-selected menu of beer and great cocktails designed in-house.

3. Bonnie is the sweetest sexiest bartender around.

4. They'll have private parties with DJ's or bands or whatever and provide excellent planning and customer service.

5. Snacks and food are amazing.  

All in all a great bar/lounge perfect for day-drinking brunch, happy hour or late night.
author: Eric S.

description:
Ahhh Asiento, how do I love thee.  Let me count the ways.  

*A nice neighborhood bar where you can actually have a conversation. Check
*It's clean and has good food that they serve until LATE. Check. 
*The people that go there are friendly (mostly read below). Check. 
*They have a good rotation of events and generally some amazing music. Double Check. 
*They make good drinks. Duh Check. 
*The people that work there and the owner are awesome! Check! 

So what's with all this 1 and 2 star bullshit below.  Did someone from the Marina come here expecting table service, or need attention. Get over it. It's a BAR. That means you order stuff from the bar and sometimes you have to wait. If your not a d-bag, you might even make some friends while your waiting. If that scares you, maybe you should stick to the tipsy pig.   Oh well, I guess the old adage holds true: Haters gotta Hate.  

In sum, do me and you a favor, avoid this place if your a d-bag. If your not a d-bag, come to a very nice bar with very nice people that has great table games, good food, and great music.
author: david c.

description:
Was there for a birthday party on Thursday night and had a blast.  This was my first experience at Asiento and I will definetly be back.  The tapas were all delicous and the hand-crafted and creative cocktail menu was off the charts.  Top all of that with cool art on the walls, a grooving dj and wonderful staff.

Favorite tapas were the Albondigas, Gambas, Calamari, Beet Salad, Bocadillas and burger (I know, we ate and shared a lot).

Favorite cocktails were The Good Idea, Sparkle Pom, and a few others that I cannot remember now...that is how good all of it was!
author: Daniel B.

description: My family stopped in for a quick drink. Dad was going in for heart surgery the next a.m. so.we all wanted just a nice,comfy lil place to hang for a bit and relax. Bartenders were really sweet. Loved the Basil Lemonade drink. YUMMY!!! It was a great eve! Thank you!!!
author: Heather S.

description: If you are looking for a hip, classy place with couches, games, $2 taco Tuesdays, yummy reasonably priced drinks, and great service, this is definitely your spot.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
My husband and I went to Asiento today for a nice brunch.  We live in the neighborhood and figured we should try it and support local businesses.  

I ordered the crabcakes benedict and my husband the breakfast sandwich with avocado.  When our food finally came (which felt like too a little long) they gave me what I ordered, but my husband got a "breakfast burrito".  
Because we didn't want to cause any issues & because we didn't want to send anything back and wait another 30 minutes for the right order, my husband opted to keep the burrito.  

We were both less than impressed with our food.  The crab cake was actually pretty disgusting I couldn't even eat more than a bite.   I swallowed maybe half of the tots, but completely did not feel satisfied with the food, especially figuring I could have gone to the corner store and bought the same frozen tots myself and made them at home. 

My husband had a couple of bites of the burrito and it was mostly just filler crap inside and it was gross.  For the price, you'd expect something a little better.  Personally, I would have been more satisfied eating a McDonalds. 

The two stars I'm giving is for the lemonade that tasted pretty good and the friendly staff.  Although, to be honest, we shouldn't have had to pay for the bartender/waitresses mistake by not entering the correct food in.  She should have taken care of that. 

We decided to book the heck out of there as fast as possible and pay our bill.   I don't have any reason to go back to this place.  Luckily, progressive ground coffee across the street from Asiento has some pretty great food.  We ended up eating there instead and felt much better. 

Unless Asiento changes their FOOD options to be a little bit better and not near frozen food/microwavable crap then we both won't be going back.   I feel like if they served frozen food from trader joes, they'd fair much better then the crap their serving.
author: Christina B.

description:
Love this little neighborhood joint. Excellent specialty cocktails--and definitely get a dirty martini with the housemade olives and olive juice. Essence of rosemary and salty goodness right there. 

Not too much food, but the kitchen is open until 11pm, and the Queso Fundido is, holy god, to die for. Just let it cool down a little before you try to get any in your mouth--the oil from the cheese is still boiling when they bring it out. Goddamn it's good!

Atmosphere is relaxed and chill, and the bartenders are almost always good at their job. Place seems to be experiencing some growth though, as my friends and I did have a bummer experience a week ago; we were totally unable to get the bartender's attention for about 15 minutes. Eek. 

Still, love this place and trust that they'll get their act together as they scale.
author: Allison S.

description:
This review is based on one experience at Sunday Brunch; take that for what it's worth.

My boyfriend had eaten brunch here previously, and was raving about it, so last Sunday, we walked over there to check it out.  There were four people in our party, I was the only one who hadn't eaten at Asiento before.  Also, we were not drinking, as I had to drive shortly, and everyone else was hung over.  I mention that, because the drinks looked interesting.

The server, who kept using the excuse "Oh, I only work here on weekends", was barely available, refilled our water glasses by carrying them back to the bar and sitting them all down randomly and then returning them, possibly switching them, and was fairly inattentive.  Also, our food came from the kitchen two plates at a time with an appreciable gap between delivery.  So, half the people at the table awkwardly waited while their food got cold for ours to be delivered.

That I could let pass, but when we got our food a full 45 minutes after we ordered, and there was a hair IN my food, it was over for me.  And, let me clarify, the hair was underneath one of the English muffins of my Eggs Benedict - so it's not like it fell off my coat (which I was wearing because it was cold in there).  Also, it was not a type of hair that anyone ever wants in their food.  The server was apologetic about it, but I was done.  I had her take my plate and I took off.

I get that this place is trying to be cute - recycling bags and boxes into menus, not having straws (?!?), and using Heinz ketchup bottles full of some other crappy ketchup - but it's so not working for me.  Honestly, with a bunch of other brunch places that turn out consistent, high quality, tasty, clean food (Beretta and Schmidt's come to mind), I can't see why I'd ever go here again.

One star for most everything, one star for the live DJ who was actually playing things that were cool; he was the best part.
author: Kim S.

description:
Do I have to give any stars here?

My bf and I were going there for their $45/per person deal for new years eve.  Got there and it was empty, but we still decided to wait a bit.  Three bartenders/waitresses ignored us the entire time we were there.  They were doing shots and eating food while we were wondering when we were ever getting any service.  Soo like any person who has a brain, we left.

We planned on spending New years there and spending lots of cash that night. lol  Anyway, HORRIBLE customer service.  I'm putting money down that this place is going out of business soon.  Teach your staff how to treat customers who chose to come to your establishment when we could go to any other thousand other places.

The owner or manager, Debbie, had the audacity to text us today that we owe them $90 for dinner there. WTF? And she said to paypal it to her.  Ridiculous.

Go there at your own risk.  You just lost two customers who would have came there over and over with our friends, and Ms. Debbie, you should be ashamed of yourself and learn how to run a business.
author: Kay T.

description: After a Reiki appointment down the street last Sunday, I met my spouse at Asiento - which he had chosen for proximity, but also based on yelp reviews. Maybe it was partly the Reiki - but Asiento just seemed like the sweetest place to be on the planet at that moment. A dj was spinning at the perfect volume. Breeze was drifting in the open windows. A happy birthday party group of lovely young people were celebrating and eating and laughing. The bartender - perhaps the owner? - gave off this incredibly nurturing vibe. She was handling the whole bar alone, and with ease - knew a lot of the customers by name but treated us as if we were part of the family. All the time with a calm and beatific smile. I had a concoction of vodka, cucumber and rosemary that was out of this world. I might not need the Reiki anymore - just Asiento.
author: Amy B.

description: Blanched Spinach balls were really awesome. Debi was cool so were the rest of the staff.
author: Kausik S.

description: Good atmosphere, better food. I'm not much of a drinker, but I was happy that the bartender still cared to make me a "special" non-alcoholic drink. My favorite thing about this bar is the food. They have a delicious cheese and tortilla strip appetizer that is amazing! I was a little unimpressed with their cheese and nut plate though. A little pricy for something that looked and tasted bland.
author: Christine L.

description: A meetup social  group I'm in went to this place for one of their meetups and I decided to go as well and invite my friend . This was our first time going but not our last. I have to say we really liked the vibe. The people are honestly friendly and not fake about it. They treat everybody the same. They have lots of board games and cards you can play for free. The music was good. The drinks are good too. I really enjoyed the Basil Lemonade and the Humming bird. I will be back. Thanks social group for introducing me to Asiento.
author: rometria g.

description:
Behind a crazy Starry Night mural - you'll find a great neighborhood bar with a chill vibe and seriously YUMMY food!

My friend had her birthday there and they arranged with her to have her own CD play while we all enjoyed a Special that she got to pick out. What was crazy is that she picked a Mango Mojito which was super time consuming for the bartenders - but they made them all night with smiles on their faces....at a discount! The owner saw that the bar was bumping and called in extra hands to help...where you'd usually see an owner trying to keep the costs down - she really wants the customer to be happy! In return, they made great tips and also found themselves charming new customers to come into the bar at the same time.

Along with the amazing drinks - they have great tapas-style food which is packed with flavor at reasonable prices! Their chef is super talented and also serves up a brunch menu that I hear is to die for.

I'll be coming back here - wanna come along?
author: Katy A.

description:
So, I have seen this some place else, wide open space, feels like you are entering some ones home, sofas, and coffee tables instead of chairs and tables. In tha background  tipica playing. Very minimalistic. Yes, it was in Buenos Aires.  So, at best this place is a decent imitation of the real thing. 
I like that they have tried to create that laid back atmosphere, I like the location right in the mission, on one of my fav streets(Bryant st). There drinks are pretty decent, I tried 2 of their specialty cocktails, and actually got a discount($2.50 off) because I checked in using Yelp,  the pomengrate something something and salty pisco punch, was Ok, I wish they were stronger...We ordered their cheeses and olives plate, again wish it was bigger(the real thing is). 
Overall 3 stars for trying, and giving me the $2.50 discount on one of the cocktails...
author: BOSHIKA T.

description:
Get the spinach burger!  It's the bomb! This place was hopping at like 5:30pm which is a good sign. I had some Templeton Rye then moved to the Basil Lemonade which is sweet drink.  They have cool games there and music.

My buddy and I had food and even though there was a communication problem regarding the guacamole chips (we got some salad instead) they were very friendly to us and let us have the salad for free and quickly brought out the missing guacamole chips right away. We are all human and mistakes happen...its how you resolve those mistakes that make you a 5 star bar.
author: Marty W.

description:
brunch is excellent, there are few places in the mission where your can enjoy a drink and the afternoon sun. This is one of them.
Great cocktails,friendly staff.
Get wine by the bottle, it;s a great deal
author: Geoff H.

description:
What's not to love here? The tasty and inventive-without-going-too-far cocktails? The reasonable price points? THE YELP CHECK-IN SPECIAL?  For all those reasons and more Asiento has become the first bar I think of when its time to get my drink on. I've been there now with friends from out of town and locals from across town, and the feeling is unanimous. On our first visit the bar was hosting the Balboa High Class of 86 reunion, and the music was all 80s (and all awesome--I'm a sucker for a good musical theme). Even with the crowd the bartenders were nice and efficient and the room never felt too crowded. 

On my next visit (while waiting on a table at Flour+Water: put your name on the list there, pop over to Asiento and have some drinks, and then head back) the bartender remembered me, hooked up my drinks, and my friends and I all got seats. On a Friday night around 10. 

In short, I'm currently scheming on how to get over there for drinks tonight. Because I want to go there all the time. And the guacamole rocks. Get some.
author: Lesly S.

description: I loved the vibe here- eclectic and loungey. There's a live DJ as well. Plenty of seating, both couches and stools. Cocktails are really tasty but weak. I had two drinks and only felt a slight buzz, which is not typical for me. Tapas are great here. Ceviche is on point, perfect balance of spice, sour, and salt. The gambas are amazing as well. Juicy succulent shrimp in a garlic butter sauce to be mopped up with bread. Yum! Next time I definitely want to try their burger.
author: Winnie T.

description: Credits to Natasha H. for a sweet find in the Mission!  We came by for a drink after dinner at Flour + water and we quickly agreed that this place is awesome.  The bartender was very friendly and made us some darn tasty drinks while we sat in the mad spacious main area.  The atmosphere is hipster, but not overly so.  Cool artwork adorned the walls around us and the crowd was super chill, no need to crank up the decibels to talk to your friends here unlike so many other bars.  I'll def be back again!
author: Eric F.

description:
I love this bar for the following reasons:

1. 5 minute drive from my house
2. Awesome owner (super friendly and nice!)
3. Good (cheap) drinks
4. They have a dj spinning on random weekdays
5. Board games!

I could go on singing their praises but everyone will want to come here and it'll turn into one of those packed pretentious bars full of wannabe hipsters. So I take it back! This place is horrible! Don't come here! Go to the real hipster bars on Mission street! ;)
author: Danielle W.

description:
What a great place with friendly staff...

Glad to have it as a neighborhood bar.
author: Kyle P.

description:
I didn't try the food but it's a cute little wine bar with decent drinks.  My favorite is the Basil Lemonade which does not taste alcoholic at all.  I also tried the Pomegranate Kiss, the Cucumber, and Car-a-lado (sp?).  The Pomegranate Kiss was okay though I'm not a fan of Orange Vodka.  The Cucumber was the worst - definitely not a girls drink of choice.  If you like whiskey, you'll probably like the Car-a-lado.

If this place wasn't so far from me, I would definitely come back to try the food.
author: Linh V.

description: Great place for groups. Loved the refreshing drink suggested by the bar tender. Enjoyed hummus and guacamole! Snacks were perfect
author: Astha S.

description:
Asiento is adorable! The space is lined with a DJ booth, shared tables and couches plus a bar, so I can imagine that you could have a number of experiences there. 

Although I didn't try the food, it looked really, really good, and I will definitely be back to try it!
author: Amber K.

description:
My absolute favorite spot for a nightcap after work!! I love all the bartenders and Debi is delightful!! The food is off the chain as well. My personal fave is the juicy burger.  Juicy meat sandwiched between an English muffin!?!?!?! Goodness, it is heaven on a plate!!

I would give ten stars if I could! ^_^
author: Jennifer N.

description: Great neighborhood Bar for me.   Really yummy tapas, board games, trivia night, and uh, what else?   Oh yeah, tasty libations.  Basil lemonade is a hit, and for eating the queso fundido is a good choice.   This is more upscale than the Jay'n Bee down the street, which is also a cool place, but Asiento is a bit more classy with couches, nice decor and of course the awesome purple painting.  Of course the crowd is different, and the prices higher, but not crazy for what you get.  Staff has always been friendly and helpful.  Overall, it's a great place to meet some old friends for a drink or three, and have some food if you don't move on to a restaurant.   Or just head there for a fun evening and meet some new friends.
author: Travis B.

description:
Nieghborhood bar! Relaxed atmosphere, great food, great drinks (and bartenders). Good selection of cocktails/wine and... I think beer too!

Also, there are board games! good times :)
author: Claire b.

description:
Hi, Asiento.  You are super close to my apartment and workplace, so you are naturally of interest to me--who doesn't want to find a great place for food and drink near their home and work?  Highlights?  The owner/manager is present a lot, and is great with customers.  The tapas, limited though they are, are well done and very tasty.  Drinks are perhaps a bit stingily poured (draft beer in a small glass, not a pint), but the house cocktails are creative and they use good ingredients (Blue Coat gin!).  Really nice interior that is casual and well designed at once.

Ways I would like to see Asiento grow: Please be consistent!  As a neighbor, I walk by all the time...sometimes you are open, sometimes you aren't, but there is little consistency.  I've checked the sign several times, promising delicious service at the very hour i stand there, but to no avail.  It would be rough to set a time to be there with others, since the open hours seem to change a lot. 

Also, the brunch scene seems to be improving in terms of food service (i love the $2 for several items, "build your own" breakfast).  Big downside of brunch: you call it a "recovery brunch," but you're pumping obnoxious techno music at full volume throughout the space.  Please play music that helps people feel like they can recover!

My main thought is that Asiento needs to find its center, so that it can fulfill the promise it has.  Love you guys.
author: Ciara W.

description:
My new favorite joint.  

Interesting and thoughtful cocktails -- and reasonable priced  (in the Mission - who would have guessed?). A nice wine selection with a selection of well priced bottles. Good to get one or 3  friends and have "una botella" on a Saturday afternoon with tapas-like food.  The queso fundito is like hot, gooey crack.  The first time I had it  I snarfed it... and ordered a second. Damn the fat. 

Good space design and comfortable atmosphere with a rare amount of space -- not having all the tables and chairs are all jammed up on each other makes this space unique. A professional grade sound system and constantly good tunes (scientifically evaluated over 6 visits) adds to the feel.   Its a place I bring peeps from NYC so as to give them the impression that not all SF bars are lame. (Sadly, an increasingly harder thing to do).

Debbie, the owner, is a total sweetheart and is rockin the "I love my bar and will bust my ass for it to be the total bomb" vibe. Much respect for this woman. 

The short haired bartender mentioned in a previous review ("this chick sucks"),  in fact, does not suck, and is actually very cool, knows her drink-making shit, and kicks serious ass on a busy night.  Impressively, I've seen her instigate an impromptu dance party  to cheesey/awesome 80's music on a slow Wednesday night. (10 people max in the place).  You try doing this. My GF and me kinda have a secret crush on her for this ability.  
 
Totally Approved.
author: Luis F.

description:
My last update was not intended to compliment.
We decided to go elsewhere - a bar around the corner where we ended the night.  No security guard there and no problems either, just a good time, chillaxing.  
It's not my bar, I don't make the rules here, this is just my opinion.  Perhaps being asked to search my bag should not be a deal breaker, but it was.  Been in the neighborhood for a long time and I have to say this is the first place with this rule.  
I suppose it makes sense and is a useful strategy for keeping certain elements out of the place.
author: Emilio O.

description:
The bar food was very good and would love to
See more meat and cheese plates
Gambas were great too. Debbie was friendly
And helpful and will go back again. The place was
Cool without pretension
author: elizabeth t.

description:
The mixed drinks are GREAT - The basil lemonade and cinnamon rum drink were delicious. 

The food is very good, but the portions are a bit small (it is a tapas place..- so I guess I just love food).

This is a really good spot to have a drink and a bite with a friend you've been meaning to catch up with because - wow- you can actually talk in this bar! You can sit in a real leather chair without having to scout out for 30 min! Its not the most happening spot, it's low-key, but great for locals who want to have a drink but don't want something as divey as Pop's or Dirty Thieves. 

And another plus.. BOARD GAMES!
author: Lucille C.

description:
Take a seat.

At the bar. Order some tapas. Have a drink. Stay a while.

Don't miss the lemon hummus. Served with eight slices of warm bread. Dip away.

Choose the chicken bocadillos. Three are served. They won't last long. Delicious. Save some hummus for bonus dipping.

Passed on a cocktail. But they looked excellent.

You can also take a seat (translation of the name) at one of the dimly lit tables. Perfect way to get lost in the intimate yet welcoming atmosphere.

Will be back for that drink.
author: Jason B.

description:
I love this bar!!!  

The atmosphere is cool and laid back without being too hipstery or pretentious.  There is plenty of seating for groups of friends to get together and catch up, which is exactly the reason I came here a few nights ago.  I was seated in the back corner with some lady friends, and although there was music being played, it wasn't too loud that we would have to yell over it.  They also have a ton of board games which led to a very interesting, and in-depth conversation about the merits of Yahtzee! which I have never played.

I had one of their specialty cocktails - the Basil Lemonade, made with Stoli Lemon Vodka, lemon juice, muddle basil served over ice in a tall glass.  So incredibly tasty, and dangerous because it doesn't taste at all like it has any alcohol.  It was very refreshing.  It was also only $8.50.  The bartender was very friendly, as were most of the staff.

Other than the parking in this area (be prepared to walk a block or two), this bar was perfect.  I'll definitely head over here again when I'm in town.
author: mariel v.

description:
Two stars for the queso fundido, three for the drinks and service.
I went there on Labor day weekend, when all the burners are out of town. We walked in an almost empty place, but the two bartenders still found a way to ignore us for a few minutes when we approached the bar to order food and drinks. I was the only one hungry so I ordered just one item on the menu: the queso fundido with chorizo. It was pretty disgunting. The cheese was stringy but flavorless and was simming in oil from its own fat. I had to look hard to find micro pieces of chorizo, and after 10 minutes the gooey mass had harden and the tortilla chips were soaked in oil.
Our drinks were good, and the noise level was perfect for conversations (again, the place was sparse that night).
author: Laure b.

description:
This place is great when I want to get away from the Mission night scene, which has become increasingly old for me now. So it was very refreshing to find a cool spot that wasn't flooded with tight skinned jeans and pabst.

A chill lounge for when you just want to sit, relax, have a drink and chat. 

Good music, great drinks, very friendly staff/bar tender... And I believe they have board games.

Another interesting fact... the neighbors complained or something about having a live dj there. So now, they have a dj spin somewhere else, with a video camera hooked up to him, and he's shows on the big screen here. But its not like the dj is in Ibiza. He's around 19th and south van ness. 

Kind of hilarious.

Good spot, go check it out... but don't tell too many people about it ;)
author: Anish B.

description:
I went to Asiento for the first time tonight. I saw it from afar...how could you miss such a cool looking building? The inside was just as nice. Cozy, great music with a dj, nice enticing menu. I have just moved to the Mission and I felt like, "Hey, this could be my go-to neighborhood bar."

Nope, ain't going to happen. Let me tell you why:

I scanned Foursquare to check in and check out tips for eating and I was pleasantly surprised to see they had two specials for 1st timer check-ins.

The bartender was very confused and said it was a deal another company made for them via Foursquare and that he could not honor it. He also badly explained that I needed to pay $20 dollars to get $10 dollars off when the deal clearly states, "Spend $15, get $10 dollars off."

In fact there were two deals for Asiento on Foursquare and he couldn't explain either of them.

I'm sorry but deals don't magically appear on Foursquare, and you can add terms of usage to them in the description. How many people might see that little orange bar and be like, "Yeaaah totally going to check that out with such a cool special." to only be disappointed with a vague explanation and a very definite no. 

First-timers count guys.
author: Alais d.

description:
Asiento will have more chances to get more stars, but I've taken some time off. It's nice to have a cool bar in the neighborhood, but a few missteps have kept me away for a while.

Good: Good drinks, decently priced beer, and the food is delicious.

Bad: The food is priced so poorly it's almost a joke. As I noted above: the food is delicious. Truly. But here's my story: I ordered the hummus. Good dish of hummus comes with 6 pieces of sliced baguette. Like, Safeway-par toasted baguette slices. 6 pieces of bread, slathered with hummus, is not enough to finish the dish. So I ask for some more bread. $3 for more slices. I'm not going to just LEAVE the hummus there, so I go for it, if a little transparently incredulous, because Bonnie says "it's fancy bread." I guess fancy bread means Safewayish baguette toasted with a drop of olive oil on it, because only 6 more pieces came. Really? It was no more than $2.00 for the baguette, but I'm paying $0.50 PER SLICE? 

Look, I appreciate that it's a new place, and they're trying to get it off the ground. But they've got almost everything going for them: great location, cool interior, fun people are there, great drinks and food. Have a little patience and let those things bring in the profits, not gouging me for several 50 cent slices of bread when there should have been more on the plate in the first place.

End rant, I'll be back someday and reconsider.
author: Nate R.

description:
Came here on an early Saturday night to find a very pleasant atmosphere.  I love that there are games to play and it definitely feels like a place that you can sit and hang out at for a long time. The food is priced well for the quality. We got a cheese plate and crabcakes for less than $20. Their drinks are inventive and obviously made with love. Their homemade syrups are delicious... they used rosemary and lemonade syrup muddled in basil with ketel one citrus vodka... there was dancing in my mouth. 

The owner is super nice and so approachable. You can tell she works hard [she was bussing our table even though she had other people working there that night!] and looks out for you [I was getting drinks to be put on a friends tab and she wanted to make sure it was ok with him... LEGIT ESTABLISHMENT... **total side bar, don't be a jerk and don't put your drinks on friends tabs without asking... meanies**]. 

It is worth giving a try, check out living social now deals for extra savings too... it's definitely a place worth checking out!
author: Megan V.

description: I really wanted to give this place more than 2 stars, but I just couldn't. I went to Asiento with 3 friends on a Friday night. The food was good and so was the music, but the service was very weak. We sat down at the bar and waited for a good 10-15 minutes before we got any attention from the bartenders and that was only because I waved them down. After we ordered food and drinks, they never checked back with us to see if we wanted more drinks (which we did) so again we had to wave them down. I understand if they were really busy and couldn't get to everyone, but they weren't. There were two bartenders next to us rolling silverware and neither one of them asked us if we needed another cocktail or more food. I guess they didn't want to get more tips that night. Such a shame because if the place is fun and the music is good then better service would make this place even better.
author: Gisel F.

description:
Summer affair is the drink I'm having. According to the hostess it will hit you hard at the beginning and then mellow out. She's right. 

I love the neighborhood feel of the bar and how comfortable it is. If you are looking for a chill night without a scence this is the place to go.
author: Nnena U.

description:
Cute neighborhood bar that lets you pass the time away with board games that are spread around the tables and sofa areas.

Came here on a Wednesday before the holidays and it  was decently busy. My friend and I seated ourselves at the bar and had a couple of their signature cocktails. Drinks were written down on pieces of cardboard which were spread across the bar. Sort of a cool concept and recycling and reusing, but I guess it just didn't work for me. The drinks themselves were pretty sweet but not too bad.

Definitely a nice little bar to visit if you're in the neighborhood.
author: Julia K.

description:
So happy to have Asiento in the neighborhood. 

I've been there several times. The bartenders and owner (Debbie) are super friendly and have a lot of love for their bar. It shows.

The food and drinks are a little pricey, but you definitely get what you pay for. In particular, the tinga tostados and guacamole are fantastic. 

On sundays they are doing a wonderful brunch till 4pm (!). $7 for one of the best breakfast burritos I've ever had.

They also have  community oriented board game nights and art creation days. 

It's a rad place that I want to stick around for a long time. It's a great addition to the neighborhood.
author: Jon S.

description: Love this neighborhood jam. Trivia mondays, Taco tuesdays. Echo that to the delicious burger and the refreshing cocktails. My favorite is the basil lemonade.
author: Gaby O.

description:
Went here for my birthday on a Sunday night. Great choice.

I had about 20 friends join me here for tapas and drinks before heading to another location and it was a great place. I emailed their info email address asking about holding a party and Debi got back to me within 12 hours. She patiently answered all of my very frank questions about layout and ambiance. She even put my favorite drink on special - gimlets! Her wonderful attitude told me that this would be a good choice, so I went for it sight unseen.

They reserved the back (though this place is open, so the "back" seems to be a bit of a misnomer) of the bar for us. The bartenders were super friendly, especially Tom (?, great hair anyway), and helped to make my party a success. They didn't seem to mind that we took up so much space and moved so much furniture. We sat on the comfy couches and chairs in the back. Both the cocktails and wines were great and reasonably priced. 

I think the other patrons (30 somethings) were a little jealous of our fun. :)

Ok, here's the reason I didn't give 5 stars: I reserve it for the best of the best. The drinks, if I remember correctly, were fantastic. The tapas were good, but not great. It was nice to have a neighborhood bar that serves food, but they don't have great envelope pushing food. By all means, if you're not a snob, you will like the food, no doubt. I did. They have this incredibly good cheesy thing. But, it's no Joya in Palo Alto. 

Also, apparently a lot of my friends had a hard time finding parking. I didn't, but three out of about seven cars had difficulty.

But, all in all, I totally recommend this place. For ambiance, for drinks, for a snack, it really can't be beat.
author: Tina D.

description:
Disclaimer: I did not order an alcoholic beverage while I was there, so I can't speak to that.

I was more than a little disappointed in the board game selection, since that was really the reason I sought out this bar. My disappointment was somewhat ameliorated by the awesome funk, disco, and old-school R&B jams the DJ was spinning, and by the funky, comfortable atmosphere. And who knows, maybe the drinks are amazing, and that helps make the board game selection seem slightly more amazing. But I now wish I'd donated my parents' old board game collection to Asiento instead of Goodwill.

And I wish there was a good board game bar in the Mission!
author: Annie W.

description: Gotta love the Yelp check in deal! They had great specialty cocktails. Their cucumber cocktail and their lemonade are reasons enough to become a regular here. I liked the dark, cozy atmosphere and leather seats.
author: Denise H.

description:
Stopped into this place to get a cocktail from my friend Moe, who's tending bar here after his rad stints running it at Triple Crown and 222.

The place is pretty great. A really chill urban art/coffee house feel, but with booze. I've often wished coffee houses had hard liqour. It appears Asiento has made this a reality for me.

On to the bevs: Solid, fresh, organic cocktail fare. The girlfriend found her new drink of summer, a couple down the way played boggle, and I watched the Giants and got solidly buzzed on top shelf mixology all in the same room.

In truth 4.5 stars. The music needs a bit of love when the iPod is in "K105" mode. But, other than that, this place is great.

Oh. And Moe is the fuckin' man behind the bar. As always.
author: Aiden B.

description:
Not to sound douchey, but this place had a good vibe.  I don't really like the word "vibe," but that's really the only way to describe it.  A spacious bar for the city, there was ample room to move about, and the space was very clean, modern and polished.  Parking in this neighborhood was also not a complete nightmare, which I appreciated.

The evening I went, there was some crazy closet cleanout event going on so there were numerous women walking around with extravagant, feathery hats.  Really, there were.  Sounds random, but it was entertaining to watch anyway.
author: Jenny R.

description:
My bestie's boyfriend took me here for the first time the other night when she was out of town. I have made it my goal to bring my own boyfriend back. Tonight we achieved my goal. And what a great achievement it was. Down tempo music. Killer couch and bar seating. Not too loud. Great system if it were.

The proprietor, Debbie, made me the best martini of my life. Which is saying a lot, considering I used to vet potential 'tenders with one test: the ability to make a great martini. Before this evening I considered myself a stellar martini maker. After this evening I have been bested. A word of advice - order a slightly dirty vodka martini straight up. If not for the booze, then for the homemade olives, juice, and hint of garlic and rosemary. There are no words. 

CON: My only gripe is the fact that they have no straws. I had fairly invasive mouth surgery recently, and anything cold or hot against my teeth hurts like a mofo. Okay, okay I get it: they want to help the environment one straw at a time. But man, this is actually a pretty big con for me, which would be understandable if only you could be my mouth for a minute. 

Summation:

Asiento is a great little not-to-divey bar in an area that needs more not-too-divey bars. I'm a big fan of dive bars, but as I get older it's kinda nice to hear something other than Motorhead and Pantera when I sit down to sip not-too-divey-martini.
author: Mel H.

description:
Loved the Mojito :D Great bar food! 

Awesome Atmosphere and cool music!

I will be back!
author: Vickie Z.

description:
I had a lady date last night with Paula T at Asiento, and I really, really like this little bar. It's just a few blocks from my house, and I've walked by it a million times without going in.  So glad that's been rectified.

It's cozy while still having lots of room to move about. It feels warm and inviting, and I can see coming in here on a cold day to warm up and play some board games. The bartender working last night was friendly and attentive, and mixed us up some super tasty cocktails. Paula and I both had the Basil Lemonade (which was absolutely delightful) and I tried the Tannenbaum, because I'm a sucker for elderflower. Paula also had a drink with cucumber and rosemary in it, and I feel like I'll be getting that one the next time I'm in, as it was freaking delicious. 

We didn't venture too much into food territory, but we did have some really tasty guacamole. I knocked one star off because there was a TV above the bar playing sports, which, well, I hate. Otherwise, go here. Have a really good cocktail. Rejoice.
author: heather c.

description: On Mothers Day, my wife and I plus six friends attended an event in the Mission District in San Francisco, and I wanted to reserve a place for eight near the event location.  Debi, the owner of Asiento was the only one nearby who could accommodate our party.  She setup a table by the windows and was able to provide great service, excellent food and drinks, and welcomed us like old friends.  Every one in the group had a good time and enjoyed the food and drink.
author: Dennis R.

description: Tasty drinks. Nice vibe. The live music was a bit too loud and seemed unnecessary, given that we were there on a Wednesday night around 11pm. That's why one star taken off from the four I would give Asiento otherwise.
author: Micah R.

description:
I went in the evening-night to celebrate some friends' special occasion.  Well, I'm sure the restaurant is great, but I am no fan of this place for the following reasons. First, let me start with what I liked.

What I liked:
- Hip crowd, good looking people
- Quaint size - I liked the layout
- Really liked the lounge area and dance floor
- Good DJs

What I disliked, why it's only okay on my rating:
- Expensive drinks - I hate paying $8 for a cocktail. I just do. It's like going to a restaurant and paying $2 for a soda pop. I hate it. Yeah, I am cheap. I am. What a cheapo, I am. Truth is, I'll pay $8 for an awesome drink ... but only if it is awesome. What do I mean? Let's use whiskey as an example. Some bottles are really well crafted, have lingering flavor that doesn't display bad cues ... these bottles are worth a lot. Other bottles are just so-so. There's nothing distinct about the flavor, or even a bit bad - moldy and flat. The good ones are well worth north of $100. Bad ones, no. 
- Noise - I mean I really don't get this part. It's a tiny space, so music volume should follow accordingly. Wouldn't be nice to have some dancy tunes that aren't going to be blowing your ear drums out? I really don't understand why people play music so loudly. Are they afraid that people aren't interested in talking? Are they afraid that if the music isn't so loud that you can't hear yourself talk, then music is not good?
author: David K.

description:
Full bar? Check.
Food? Check.
Board games? Check.
Sassy bartenders? Check.
Comfy chairs and ample room to spread out? Check.

Asiento is a cool new space in the Inner Mission, the type of place where I could see myself playing dominoes while downing Hendrick's and eating cookies. Oh wait, that was last night.

I didn't try any food (other than said cookies) but the menu looked interesting. I did think that drink prices were a buck or two too high though, especially for the neighborhood.

Four solid stars...count me as an Asiento fan!
author: phil h.

description:
Oh Liver...you will be ruined.

This little nugget of goodness just popped up around the corner from work, and how the days seem less long. With food and drink how will I resist stopping for happy hour? I won't...I simply won't.

The staff is always awesome - tolerant of my loud, booze friendly co-workers - and gracious - giving us food to help sober up. The music is great, with or without a DJ, and I'm always tempted shake my rump (decorum Chia...decorum). 

I'll be back...as a matter of fact, it is almost happy hour...
author: Chia C.

description:
Thank God for Yelp Drinks; without that promo, I could very well have never discovered Asiento! 

Asiento is basically what I want my dream house bar to look like, complete with the cocktail menu and bartender. The space is open and warm; there is a gorgeous wooden bar; the seating areas have these cute wooden crates for tables. They play great music and the vibe is really chill. The only small downside is that there aren't a ton of seats, so hopefully they get some more in couches once they become more popular. 

My favorite of the four house cocktails I tried was the Basil Lemonade, but the Manhootan, Cucumber Rosemary, and (I think?) Cherry Kiss were all really great. I will definitely be back for their tapas and more cocktails!
author: Rebecca P.

description:
This is a really lovely little space - I think probably best for a cocktail - never mind the food, however they have a "specialty cocktail" list - for $8.50 each yet their Manhattans are made with Evan Williams (lower shelf bourbon) - not so specialty.
Their "tapas" should not be called tapas because tapas are Spanish - and suddenly places are calling any small bites, tapas. 
The meat and cheese plate was totally amateur - slices of standard salami, cheap crackers and the cheeses were basis mild yellow cheddar, boring brie and MUENSTER. Really? Not even a manchego?
Not to mention there was a dog in there - why are dogs suddenly allowed everywhere? Go here after work for a drink - and then go to Universal for dinner.
author: Joel B.

description:
I've lived within 100 yards from this place for a lil over a year now and finally ventured in this past weekend. I've clearly been missing out.

Good drinks, good crowd, and most importantly they have the 1970's boardgame Pass Out!
author: Krista S.

description: Nice place for an early evening drink, but don't expect too much from the food. Also, they don't take credit cards so come prepared.
author: Rolf M.

description: This is my friend Debi Cohn's bar- she's an old friend from college. As I have always loved bars/restaurants in the Mission, when she told me she had opened Asiento, I was excited to check it out. A friend had just returned from working overseas and I suggested we meet there. What a great choice! It was really comfortable, a casual ambiance, yummy cocktails (I recommend the basil lemonade vodka drinks), and a wide assortment of tapas, including $2.00 tacos (small but delicious). I didn't know it was cash only but they kindly let me use my debit card. Since it was a Wednesday, it was not packed but I imagine it gets that way on a weekend. It's a perfect chillout place for a weekday though!
author: Wendy N.

description:
Updated review.  I liked this place quite a bit at first, and it still has a lot going for it -- great space, not too crowded (for now), decent prices, and friendly bartenders.  

However, they told me they accepted credit cards but then tried to impose a $20 minimum, which 'aint allowed.  See -- http://usa.visa.com/about_visa/ask_visa/index.html -- " Minimum Purchase: U.S. retailers may require a minimum purchase amount on credit card transactions. The minimum purchase amount must not exceed $10 and does not apply to transactions made with a debit card."  I didn't have cash and was only purchasing two drinks (one being non-alcoholic), which came to under $20.  Rather than owning up to it, the owner got very testy and argumentative.  Had she simply accepted my card and implored me to bring cash the next time, I'd have been a happy customer. Instead I left with a rather bitter taste in my mouth.
author: Jen R.

description:
I'm a little torn writing this post but my last experience wasn't as bad. Plus, I plan to go back fairly often since we are practically neighbors.

First time, I ordered a beet salad and a beer. The dressing had absolutely no flavor, shrimp was overly spicy, and service was terrible. I'm not too picky about service, but the guy at the bar asked if I wanted another drink so I figured, why not? Needless to say, I never got my beer and didn't bother asking after my stale beet salad though I was tempted to wash it down.

Last time, it was Taco Tuesday night. Ordered veggie and shrimp tacos which were redeeming and enough to win me back more Tuesdays. Looking forward to Trivia Night at some point :D

I do love the atmosphere. There's a DJ, people are lively, and there's a TV which will come in handy for football season.
author: Annie L.

description:
I was super excited when this bar got a make-over.  Walking distance from my house, fancy cocktails, snacks, and a game night!  So why two stars?  

1. over-priced not very good at all food.  $8 for chips and a lil' thingy of guac? C'mon, son. 
2. a particular bartender, a lady with short red hair, who gives me shit every time I order anything.  She is rude and pretentious, and not in a "oh, that's the thing with this bar" cool way either.  Whether it's lecturing me on the environment when I ask for a straw or informing me of the (WRONG) way to make my favorite drink, it's to the point where I don't want to order a thing from her, because I don't want a hard time.  I just want a drink, lady. 

*I should add that I bartended or years, and usually make the extra effort  when ordering and give benefit of the doubt for industry folks.  But this chick sucks.
author: Allison D.

description: Nice ambiance, but some rather odd music playing (whoo girl music) - with mellow ambiance, good beer on tap but not many.
author: T O.

description: $5 "kill-the-bottle drinks" and their Jenga drinking game made a quirky and fun night. Also, awesome cocktails and a cool ambience that fit perfectly into the mojo of The Mission.
author: Beau D.

description:
A pretty decent local spot close to my house.  It's definitely a huge step over the Monkey club that was here previously that was a terrible bridge and tunnel type of bar.   I went here for dinner and had the Albondigas/meatballs, the Bocadillos and a Virgin mojito.  Overall I found the food to be decent but a little on the greasy/filling side.  I think the place would be great for a date since it's very loungey. 

The strange thing was that I was sitting at the bar and I couldn't just open a tab, I had to give a credit card.  Like they don't trust that you're going to walk out?  When I got there there was a TV on that was really loud since people were watching a game.  Strange because it's not a sports bar.  I'd definitely go back to try some of their specialty drinks and try some different dishes again as well.
author: Mitch A.

description:
A great neighborhood bar. A friend of mine moved down the block from here, and we were just exploring the neighborhood. 

Been here on a Friday night, and a couple of Saturdays, and the crowd never disappoints. The bartenders are super friendly, and they mix some pretty strong drinks. Its a small run establishment, the owner, and the 2 bartenders. 

Yet to try the food, but it did look sumptious. 

The place itself is quite well done. They have some sofas to lounge around on, and a few tables as well. There's a rather large open space, for when the place gets crowded. More often that not, however, it is a rather quiet place to just chill out and enjoy the evening.
author: Gurpreet S.

description:
Simple review:

1) Try a mixed drink, they are all good, priced right, and don't come in a thimble.
2) Buy a burger. There is seriously no better in San Francisco.
3) Talk to someone. It's a friendly neighborhood kind of place.
4) Thank the bartenders, they are all very nice and have made your visit special.
author: Eric S.

description: Cool neighborhoody bar in a less busy part of Mission.  It's a great place to chill out, have a couple of drinks, grab a bite to eat, and listen to music.  It's got that nice semi-hipster-y wood interior (I don't know how to describe it actually, but I'm going with it).  The chicken bocadillos make for a tasty snack.  Pine Street beer.  Taco Tuesdays.  Dance, deep house, and disco Fridays.  Definitely a little gem in the neighborhood.
author: Dan P.

description: Came here to meet up with a friend a couple months ago, the menu look nice, so did the cocktails. I order one that came on the rocks, tall glass. When I ask for a straw I was reply " we don't carry straws, we are trying to safe the planet one straw at a time..." I thought, Umm very Eco friendly??... You know there is biodegradable straws.?... I finish my drink and order a beer instead, I was hoping to try more drinks but Naah
author: Karen P.

description: This place was a true gem. Best tapas I have ever had. We were in town for the weekend and just walking around and found this place. Thank god we did. Basil Lemonade! Enough said, it was fantastic and refreshing. We tried just about every food item avail, we loved the tostadas with chicken. But everything was terrific. A must try!!,
author: Eric M.

description:
When I heard there was a new bar near my work from a yelp email, I got so excited! Asiento has a good amount of space, great drink selection, and cool bartenders. I have to remember to come back on Wednesday for board game night, or even taco Tuesday, 

The happy is hour special is pretty unique and based on first drink ordered, which becomes a special from that moment for one hour. Pretty standard looking tapas like  guacamole and hummus and no mixed nuts here as they serve free cookies at bar.
author: Laura P.

description: Love this place. Great ambience, drinks that are not too expensive and great service. There are deals and specials such as $2 tacos on Tuesdays and $6 cocktails if you check in on Yelp. They also have a ton of board games in the back and you can usually find a place to sit.
author: Xteethx B.

description: Not only do I love my neighborhood bar and everyone that works there, but tonight was extra special. We decided that we absolutely HAD to play Cards Against Humanity and called the bar to see if they had it. The bartender said "I have it at home come to the bar and it'll be here in 30." Fucking cheers. Love you guys.
author: Liisa L.

description: I looooooooove this place. It kind of feels like a living room. I wish it was my living room. Very comfortable. It's great for happy hour, especially Taco Tuesday. The first time I walked in, saw a DJ and groaned, expecting having to yell-talk at my friends over the THUD-THUD-THUD. But it was nice, ambient music played at a completely reasonable volume! Great drinks, great food, very well-priced. Plus, they have games. I find few greater joys than playing Apples to Apples at a fun neighborhood bar.
author: Marissa B.

description:
I was supposed to spend New Years at a roller disco at Cellspace but the po shut it down. =( 

Our group wandered into this place and ended up having an awesome time. The place was pretty crowded but bartenders were all very attentive and getting drinks was a piece of cake. Every drink was delicious especially the basil lemonade. 

Around midnight, they even passed out party favors and free champagne (which they were very generous with)! 

If you run out of cash, they do take cards but there's a $20 minimum. That shouldn't be an issue because the drinks here are fantastic and you will consume many. I'll definitely return for more drinks and to try their tapas plates as well!
author: Vivian L.

description: I love this place because it's just really chilled out. It's clean, not a dive, but not fancy either. The food is good, especially on Taco Tuesdays, and the owner Debi is really friendly and cool. There is a DJ and the music is never too loud, and you can chill out on the comfy chairs and play board games.  Cocktails are good, beer selection is good, and the wines are good. It's pretty much perfect!
author: Caroline C.

description:
I'm a regular at the Monday Trivia Night and pop in for the occasional beer (or three) whenever I can. They have a solid selection of beers on tap and in the bottle and I've always found the atmosphere to be warm and welcoming. The food menu is limited yet diverse and nicely executed. As I've said before, I'm a sometimes-pseudo-vegetarian and the way I've heard people talk about their Juicy Burger, I may have to devote one of my rare cheat days (usually only reserved for St. Patrick's Day and Giants games for superstition purposes) to the consumption of one. With THAT said, I HIGHLY recommend the Guacamole (nature's butter done RIGHT- lightly seasoned but still very flavorful with an admirable consistency), Shrimp Ceviche (it's like a delicious fiesta of shrimp, lime, and cilantro in your mouth- you might even moan in appreciation), the Cheese Plate (Who doesn't like cheese? Especially when it's accompanied by AMAZING house-marinated olives and delicious spiced nuts that compliment the Camembert PERFECTLY. Seriously.), and the Queso Fundido (again, CHEESE! Rich, melted gooey goodness! YUM!).

To make a long story short, it's a neighborhood gem that you should definitely check out. And then frequent!
author: Ashley K.

description: Lovely ambiance, great drinks, great tapas food. Little expensive, but worth it! Highly recommend the gambas (sautéed shrimp). Will be going back soon as I realised when leaving they sold Blackthorn (a local cider to me in Bristol, UK). Good DJ as well, throwing up some lovely background mash ups.
author: Tom S.

description: Solid Sunday Brunch spot. Like the food, like the drinks, like the atmosphere. Only complaint is the owner needs to be less invovled or at least less visible.  It sometimes feels like she is holding court, and during these times the staff is far more focused on her and her friends than the customers, which is totally cool because she owns the bar but it seems to happen frequently during Sunday Brunch... "I guess I'll get my own water".
author: Greg R.

description:
YELP SPECIAL ALERT: $6 drink (originally $8.50) when you check in!

What a great place to come and hang out.  The urban, home feel it has makes you feel very comfortable and welcomed.  The waitresses and bartenders are so friendly that they literally come and hang out with you.  You know that bar on How I Met Your Mother that you always wished you could go to?
