This is that place and for me, this is our new hangout/home.

My husband was actually here from 12 PM to 9 PM just hanging out and having a good time.  I joined them to watch the Giants game (GO GIANTS!!!) and I am SO glad I came here.  The food was pretty good.  Good portions in conjunction with the inexpensive prices.

-Guacamole and chips: Fresh, chunky, homemade guac that tasted delicious.  It was a tad too lemony, as I never put lemon in my guac but I am glad it wasn't too spicy.
-Lemon hummus: The breads were pretty good and weren't too hard.  The hummus' ingredients blended nicely together.
-Queso Fundido w/ Chorizo:  MY FAVE!  This was SOOOO good and reminds me of the queso I had at an amazing Mexican restaurant in Newport Beach.  Gooey, melted, delicious cheese with bits of chorizo that wasn't spicy at all.  I am just glad this place doesn't overly spice their food.  That's what is going to keep me coming back.
-Hot dogs: Premium beef hotdogs that were cooked to perfection.  They might have just had these for the Giants game but they were goooooood.  And the price was really reasonable.  I hope they stick to these as a quick snack while you're drinking.
-Drinks: I didn't have any drinks this time but I am planning on going back for their Bitten Cherry and Zombie drinks.  The husband said they had a good selection of beers.  Lots of creative cocktails for sippers like me.

Bonnie was the bartender that came to hang out with our group and had been working the brunch shift.  That's how awesome she thinks this place is that she works and STILL wants to hang out there.  And with customers no less.  She was nice enough to notice that we ran out of chips and quickly got us some more chips.  Which was really sweet considering she wasn't working.  That's an awesome bartender.  Gets us chips and didn't charge us.  I really hate places that charge you for extra chips or breads for a dip that goes with chips or bread. 

Towards the end of our stay, the owner came to hang out with us too!  This is a fabulous woman that has a real zest for life.  She was so sweet and fun.  She gave us a round of beers and when I asked if she had any desserts she said no but gave us some mini brownies.  That was enough to curb my sugar craving.  Seriously, this place is great and will make you feel at home! 

This place is for SURE a 5 star place but I am giving it 4 stars, FOR NOW, because they don't have a dessert menu.  That was one thing I really missed.  Progressive Cafe across the street has ice cream and shakes and that's great but I actually think that Asiento would do really well if they sold awesome shake concoctions.  Alcoholic and non-alcoholic.  I think this is the perfect place to have something like that.  When one of our friends said they were getting a shake, I got really excited and said, "They make them here?!?!  That's AWESOME!"  But then he said that we had to go across the street.  Since this place is more of a hang out than a restaurant, they would really benefit from having a good, unique dessert menu and would definietely put them more on the map.

This place has no where to go but up and I am glad I discovered this hidden gem.  Thanks for making such a great place available.  Can't wait to see you guys again!
author: Victoria C.

description: I really dug this place. It was very spacious, good menu, nice bartendress, good open space conducive to chatting and catching up. I likey.
author: Andrew K.

description:
Had a date lined up and invited him to mission to eat. Looked up tapas and found Asiento. Called to see what the wait was and immediately felt this was the place to go. The host on the phone was so engaging and lovely. Made me feel comfortable and welcomed even though I hadn't even come in yet. 5 stars! 
Beat my date there so I decided to take a seat in their plethora of furniture, all very comfy looking. Every one of the friendly patrons looked like they were having a great time. What a variety of people!
My date arrived and we ordered some drinks from an older woman bartender. She must have been the owner considering how she welcomed us and was all around a delight to meet and interact with.
We sat down, finished our drinks and felt hungry.
So we went up to the other bartender. She was a younger woman with shorter hair.
Complete contrast experience from the other bartender.
She was dismissive, impatient and snappish.
She got argumentative when my date and I tried to order.
She showed her true ugly side.
I've met some jerk bartenders in my day (look at my review of the hookah bar) but she totally interrupted what would have been an awesome date with her baaaaaad attitude.

I'd say, get rid of her Asiento.
You'd have got a five star if she hadn't been there.
author: Cub H.

description: I have been here once. Awesome place!!the drinks are fairly price and the food is delicious. If you like tapas like servings this place is worth checking out. The neighborhood is a little quiet though.
author: Krishnan D.

description:
Nice atmosphere but the food is extremely overpriced. Their specialty cocktails are tasty and about on par for fancy cocktails these days.
Brunch is slow, and also pretty expensive.

It is a nice place though, and fills a niche for a nice bar in this neighborhood.
author: Rennie L.

description: Good Tuesday night music. Chill vibe.
author: Inigo M.

description: How anyone could not give this place 5 starts in beyond me. Amazing affordable food. Quirky but totally on top of it staff. The owner is constantly working to improve the place and loves feedback. She's around daily and goes out of her way to make you feel welcome.  Sure, you can pay MORE money to be with MORE pretentious people who talk about nothing but their high-tech world, OR you can come to Asiento, meet neighbors, lose your mind with food that is so good you'll think you are at a fancy restaurant, and best of all, you can hear yourself think. You can have a conversation without shouting. If you want to know where to find me, you should check Asiento, and I don't even drink.
author: Lori S.

description:
Awful drinks. Terrible service. Ambiance is okay.

Ordered two drinks at the bar that were very similar. Bartender served both drinks to me and I asked which one was which. She yelled at me for not understanding the difference between the two drinks and told me that she prefers "self reliance." I responding by joking with her and she whispered some things under her breath while giving me the nastiest look I had seen on my vacation in San Francisco. The food looked good, but I didn't bother eating it since I lost my appetite from the confrontation with the bartender. I might consider going back during the day when the mean bartender isn't working there.
author: Desean G.

description: What a great place to call my local! Perfect little neighborhood bar with a fun vibe.
author: Matt T.

description:
I liked 2 of their dishes, although I have tried about 4 of them.  I am definitely a fan of the Tostadas and the Crab Cakes.  I didn't like Bocadillos (aka little sandwiches: the bread was too hard and dry) and the Queso Fundido (too cheesy with not enough beef chorizo in there and had a lot of oil/grease).

Parking wasn't so bad to find in the neighborhood around 7pm when I got there.  I liked the fact that the place wasn't crowded and it had lounge chairs to sit on.  I had a great time.
author: Wendy T.

description:
Went to Asiento for a friend's casual birthday get-together around 6:30pm on a Friday.  There were about 20 people in this comfortable, wide open lounge space and 1 friendly bartender serving drinks and taking orders.   

I had their house sauvignon blanc, lemon hummus, and cheese, salami and bread platter.  All delicious.  The specialty cocktails looked delicious and are worth a try on my next visit.  

I noticed they have a number of classic board games for people to play.  That alone gets an A+ in my book.  

Parking in the area is a bit challenging, but not impossible.  

I'll definitely be back.
author: Dudley F.

description: The juicy burger is delicious and the queso fundido is heavy but stellar. Have them with a Basil Lemonade.
author: Borja Z.

description: Awesome bar with good Cocktails. They also have some amazing Tapas. They have board games too. Love it!
author: Sameer B.

description:
Cool staff, great drinks, kind of off the beaten path, not full of douchebags... What more could you want in a neighborhood bar? 

Might be cool if they had board games, dessert and a couple more couches, since it's such a chill environment...

**Update** they do have boardgames (I just didnt know where to look) and are working on adding desserts to the menu! Like like like like!
author: Jodie B.

description: This place give me and my man food poisoning!  Avoid the carnitas sliders and the sausage tapas!
author: Angelica G.

description: With its tie dye-esque blue and purple swirling exterior, Asiento is a super chill little place with great eats, a specialty cocktail menu (try The Good Idea), and cool crowed.  The bar staff were friendly and fun and the crowd was chill.  It's removed enough away from Valencia and Mission that it's not uber-packed, but it was still populated with plenty of patrons for Sunday brunchies and drinkies.
author: shojua p.

description: So cute and comfy and friendly, with none of the hipster frenzy of just a few blocks down. Great place to grab inventive cocktails and a snack (go for the shrimp - the fusion stuff hit or miss) before seeing a show at Brava Theatre.
author: Faith A.

description: Good drinks & good selection of board games!! It's like Christmas with your family... minus the drama!
author: Timsy S.

description: I visited SF over the holidays and met up with a group of friends here.  Parking was SF (so freakin') horrible, as is customary in The City.  The bar is small with limited seating so it wouldn't be ideal for a group of more than 3 unless you don't mind standing.  The prices for the tapas style dining and drinks were a bit inflated as the place is kinda trendy.  The mixed drinks left a little something to be desired, namely more booze for the asking price. The DJ was one of the things I liked best about this bar.  I'm not familiar with the neighborhood, so I scoured Yelp review of this and a few nearby spots.  If I returned to the area, I'd check out one of the other bars before going back to here depending on the size of the party that I'm with.
author: Randell E.

description: This is a really cool little bar tucked away in the Mission. Their specialty drinks are moderately priced at $8.50 and they serve delicious bar food late into the night. They also had a DJ spinning music on a Thursday night, which I wouldn't expect from a bar in the Mission.
author: Andrew M.

description:
Meh. This place is just ok. With so many incredible locations that are so close to Asiento, it's a competitive few blocks. I find it really noisy on most nights, and I think the food could definitely be better. The drinks are reasonably priced but nothing special.
On cold nights it can get drafty. In short, you can walk another block and do way better.
author: D Z.

description: Hmmm... left $5 in cash tip on a $18 tab only to find it put back on to my debit card. Tip twice? Should have guess this place was 'that kind' of bar when I was charged $3 for a club soda. Won't be going back.
author: Andy A.

description: This place is a great refuge from the typical Mission bar and since it's a mere block from my place, I'm pretty excited to have such a nice place so close. It's a little pricier than other Mission bars, but it's really laid back and the bartenders are really nice (even when you're being indecisive). I'd go back in a heartbeat! (which incidentally is about how long it takes me to get there)
author: Chris S.

description:
I appreciate the response from Debi the owner regarding my previous post. It was a bad night and I was viscerally angry when I wrote the review so let me ammend it now in a more accurate and clear manner.

The drinks were in fact good, as was the atmosphere, the cheese plate and the decor. I have up until my last encounter enjoyed coming to this place and it deserves the good stars that it has received I am sure. I have since checked with my bank and the second charge was reversed, following my post. Thanks for taking care of that.

To Debi- I still feel there was a little bit of "calling me out" even in your reply to my post. Stopping just shy of using my full name despite it appearing no where on my profile. If I had to guess after years in the restaurant business myself I would wager that this is your first foray into the business. But here is the rub, it's not your living room. I paid WHAT WAS OWED and included a gratuity. You will not like everyone that walks through the door, and I know you want to get all momma bear if you feel someone under tipped (which I did not) but you can't. Unless you want them to write bad yelp reviews and tell everyone they know not to go there. That's how it works. My ego will survive the encounter I hope yours will too. Best of luck with your project.
author: J R.

description: Great space - lots of room for parties and the tapas are great! You can even get a table - window side in the sun, on the weekends! There is usually a DJ playing good tunes, too! The owner is wonderful and always has a smile on her face! Will happily return again!
author: Pam W.

description: The food ,the drinks, and the all around vibe of this place is great. I had a great interaction with the bartenders and other patrons. We rolled out of there full,smiling and buzzed.
author: Biff H.

description: Great little place! Went there for the first time last night, also happened to be Daniels first night bar tending, he was super friendly and makes awesome cocktails, he made it such a pleasant experience I will definately be back! Also try the burger, it was the first burger Ive ever eaten that did not need ketchup, so so savory. Everything was well priced too, go check it out.
author: Alyssa M.

description: it's tight. good tapas. ample bar. fun place to dance, check out music and connect with friends.
author: cool d.

description: This spot is perfect for night time bites, entertainment and a relaxed atmosphere.  Its not one of those places you go to be seen but it a place I love to meet friends in.  The food is good and really nicely priced.  My go-to spot for some wine and tapas.
author: megan K.

description: My buddy Chendo is doing a Downtempo monthly thing here...It's a cool spot..with good drinks and food and stuff...the crab cakes were bomb...the melty cheese thingy was super good...ya know...standard tapas bar nomz....i like!!
author: Indy N.

description: I was so thrilled with the level of customer service when the owner Debi contacted me and truly heard my concerns and responded kindly to them. I was very impressed as to how she invited me back as her guest and made recommendations that I might like better. I gave it a second try and absolutely loved the food! My favorite were the tostadas de tinga and the cheese and chorizo melting pot. DELICIOUS! I was welcomed graciously and enjoyed my night. I highly recommend Asiento! Will be back for sure.
author: Christina M.

description: This little treasure is great. The drinks are weak but the food and ambiance was great.
author: Deena B.

description: About 6-8 months ago,I left a horrible review about this bar. Honestly,I was a very unhappy person looking for any excuse to hate anything. I went back on another night,because I'm lonely,met the owner by chance and fessed up to being the one who left the stinking review. She could not have been nicer and more genuine. I just now got around to writing the real deal review,because my life has continued to collapse around me. The bar is super great,chill, professional and an asset to the neighborhood.
author: Koni L.

description:
the owner, debi, sent me an email after my last update and she was not pleased that her staff was taking up so many seats.  she apologized, told me to come back and that i should let her know it was me.  she also said that she would be talking to her staff.

i appreciated her email.  i've always liked debi - kudos on the customer service!
author: Lauren P.

description: Recently discovered asiento in my n'hood after 2 years of living here-yikes!!  Fun place with friendly service and great selection on cocktails and beer. First trip happened to land on taco Tuesday-$2 tacos at very tasty value. They are small but definitely worth 2 bucks. They had a DJ the night we were there but the following week no DJ.... the following week a DJ-it varies with a variation of music from down tempo to drum n bass to trip-hop.  Would be nice if they had a set night since there is nothing as nice as drinking great drinks, eating great tapas and listening to great music in the one setting. Also great comfie seating selection, especially on a warm day when they open the main windows, gives a nice outdoor feel. Nice artwork and overall friendly atmosphere at ok reasonably priced prices.
author: Laura K.

description:
So, as we were heading into this area for the first time ever, we were trying to find restaurants within a few blocks of our friend's house (the ultimate destination later in the evening). Asiento popped up on Yelp, along with a few notable others, so we opted for Asiento and their tapas menu. As soon as we walked in we realized that this place is much more of a bar than a restaurant, but no matter - we were fine with grabbing drinks and finding a more sit-down spot for after. Their cocktail list is fun -- I opted for their basil lemonade and their rosemary something-or-other before we moved on and loved them both (though the Basil Lemonade was arguably more delicious). My boyfriend also seemed happy with his 'Manhootan', though that's never a particularly hard sell for him. The space is actually really awesome (kind of wish we stayed longer or lived closer): it's pretty big with a lounge-y area, the bar area, and a few tables that are perfect for groups (and for tapas). Plus they have BOARD GAMES! Also notable: super friendly staff with the kind of personalities that more bartenders should have. Upbeat, fun spot. 

For people looking for a DINNER spot, I wouldn't say that this is your place (just FYI), but if you're looking for a light bite and great drinks, definitely pop in!
author: Shannon E.

description:
Great fresh tapas -loved the perfect prawns n cheesy chips wow!
wide selection of tasty wines-cool casual welcoming joint
Refreshing Euro/Latin yummy drinks
Comfy unpretentious
good tunes to boot-did I hear a DJ is on the way?
Owner personable with zest for life:-) 
No peanuts in kitchen food allergy friendly
Will go sit my seat at Asientos again when back in San Fran!
author: kira lee m.

description:
I can't say enough about how great this place is!

I've been to Asiento twice now- once for the Recovery Brunch, and once for the Super Bowl. Both trips were impressive. The brunch menu is small, but nothing on there disappoints. Bonus: whatever you order for brunch comes with these KILLER tater tots! The drinks are innovative without being too crazy (Basil Lemonade is as refreshing as it sounds), and the place is so friendly you're likely to be served by the owner. The Super Bowl turnout was what impressed me most- it was like being at someone's house but with a better beer menu. The owner was running around with samples of chicken wings and mozzarella sticks, there was a build your own hot dog bar, and cocktails were at happy hour prices! Seating became limited after awhile (ironic for a place called asiento) but it has such a great, homey vibe that will keep you coming back.
author: Rose M.

description: Stopped in for a drink and catchup convo with a friend. Asiento was the perfect place for it - plenty of space and the right volume, with a lively crowd to watch. Service at the bar wasn't anything special but it got the job done.
author: Megan G.

description: Asiento I LOVE YOU!!!!! A great place to have drinks with great company. The board games are genius! Makes me feel like I'm drinking with friends at home, but with an endless liquor cabinet
author: Johnny C.

description: Recently went to Asiento's and I will DEFINITELY be back again !!! the vibe was amazing and the food was DELICIOUS !! You have to get the cheese dip its BOMB !! & I happen to go on a night when they were serving Mango Mojitos which were to die for ... definitely will be back !!
author: Felicia T.

description: This bar has an amazing Monday night trivia.  It also features some really cool special drinks.  The food is very pricy, but it is an adorable date spot with a cool atmosphere.  Also, there are lots and lots of boardgames! I love it!
author: Marin G.

description: I had the best crab cakes ever at Asiento, and the staff its super friendly! Amazing sound system and vibe, so I highly recommend it!!!
author: Adnan S.

description: I really enjoyed my visit to Asiento. The food was delicious (especially the spinach ball special), drinks were good, and the atmosphere was great. The reason I give Asiento three stars is the portions are small for the price. I definitely went out for dinner right after leaving here. The music selection was a bit odd. They went from playing early 2000s music to 80s music. I also went during regular happy hour time at most mission places but Asiento had no deals going on. Overall I'd go back though.
author: Saralee L.

description:
a GREAT new spot!!

its off my usual stomping path, however i do frequent Gallery Hijinks' openings just down the block, and this was one hell of a find Jenn T. !!!
it shall become our customary pre-game stop!

the snacks and small plates are a'plenty +
delicious specialty cocktails AND a yelp check-in deal +
no silverware or straw-zone makes for a super sloppy show from me -
very friendly staff and owner +
good vibe. lively, yet chill bunch. nice atmosphere +
[for that part of town] pricey/drinks lacking-enough-booze/maybe i have a hi tol.=/  -
they just launched a BRUNCH menu with TATER TOTS! ++
pumpin sound/speaker set up +

its really a special little gem, a warm little nook. 
and i can't wait to go back!
author: Kaylan S.

description: What a fabulous establishment!  I came here under the previous owner several years ago and hadn't been back since. WOW! What a difference. Debi (the owner) has worked magic here to create the most wonderful environment that is perfect for any occasion.  Whether it's for having a big party (like just I did on Saturday) or relaxing and playing a board game while sipping a delicious wine, this place is perfect. Debi was so accommodating to us. She created drink specials and signage for the front of the building as well as inside the lounge for our special event. The bar staff were the nicest and most attentive ever.  This is definitely a GREAT addition to the neighborhood. I am sad I don't live closer because I would probably hang out here all the time if I did.  Also, the food is spectacular.  My girlfriend said that the burger was "the best she'd ever had!"
author: Caroline T.

description: the burger rocks!!! unfortunetely it could not balance out the cocktails, which tasted like a gasoline bomb. all in all, I'd say the food is good, but nothing special. The waiters should definitely visit a cocktail workshop and while at it, they should practice being friendly.
author: Daib S.

description: Very nice, well hidden bar with really tasty and creative bites/appetizers. Great place to have a drink and bite to eat while hearing some great music.
author: Fernando J.

description: Only bar I know of which carry's gluten free beer "Daula". They also serve sake which is rare. Food is above average, Just an all around good spot.
author: sam l.

description: The cocktails are delightful, and the bartender (Bonnie) even better. I would 100% recommend this place to my friends.
author: Whitney C.

description: Wow, can't believe I didn't review this place sooner. First went on April 16th, went back the next day for brunch. Great food (tapas), great cocktails, great service, and a very nice wine selection (just enough really good choices, not overwhelming). Very mellow local atmosphere (at least so far). Plenty of space, and cozy. At brunch we had a nice chat with the owner, she was a riot. My only complaint about this place is so minor it's almost not worth mentioning: they don't have any dessert! Otherwise, my favorite local hangout - until it gets too popular and crowded. Which will be soon, I suspect. Go now, while you can enjoy the calm.
author: Sam Z.

description: Great spot, good drinks, colorful painted barstools. Bartender was kinda douche-y though, or it woulda been five stars.
author: Kathryn s.

description: this is one of my favorite happy hour and early evening spots. it's sort of in the mission/potrero hill area a couple blocks away from general hospital and has a friendly neighborhood bar vibe. bar food is very good and refreshing, without the usual battered fried stuff. i've only usually been here between 6pm-10pm on weekdays, so i'm not sure how it is on your peak hour friday/saturday nights, but for those earlier weekday hours, it's a great place to get together with some friends or coworkers and be able to chat and hang around. on warmer days and if you're there early with the light out, they open up their full height window/walls. finally, i don't even live in this part of the city, but when i want a somewhat central yet convenient spot to meet up with friends without having to deal with the trendiest areas in the city, this is my go to spot and everywhere i've introduced to this place loves it.
author: Oleg P.

description: The previous tenant of this space, Monkeybar, was such a huge disappointment.  The location has so much potential, and, thankfully, Asiento has fully realized that potential.  Our hood has plenty of dive bar options, but not too many options if you want a classier specialty cocktail and some good eats, and Asiento definitely offers both.  My wife and I stopped by Sunday evening and ordered 5 or 6 different tapas (gambas, hummus, bocadillos, spring rolls, crab cakes, and cheese plate, if I remember correctly) and everything was top notch.  The cheese board wasn't quite as exciting as everything else, but other than that, the food, drinks and service (hooray Bonnie!) were all really fantastic.  We'll definitely be coming back!
author: Steve G.

description:
it's nice to finally visit asiento with a friend who i can talk to without yelling across the way; i met bonnie and haley who were bartending that night. we had a couple of drinks and sat next to the dj booth which played some old tunes. they have this large chalk board that lists their wine, cocktails and tapas menu. it's definitely a watering hole for the locals in the area. bonnie and haley were so nice and very personable. haley brought some brownies for us to sink our teeth into; really cool. 
 
the vibe's pretty chill and intimate here. great to take a few friends to nosh on tapas, enjoy some libations to your heart's content and catch up. i'd come back here again. as you know, it's always such a daunting chore to find parking in this neighborhood since blowfish is also down the street.
author: Mika D.

description: GAMBAS! Delicious. Bartenders are great and make reliable drinks. I love all the food and it's pretty reasonably priced.
author: Lauren C.

description: A chill place to hangout, have a great cocktail and a bite to eat. Great decor that makes for a relaxed environment. Not too loud so that you can hold a conversation with a group of friends.  Love the space scape mural on the outside of the building.
author: Jason S.

description: I went to Asiento for the first time a few days ago, and I couldn't believe I hadn't been in before.  They atmosphere is very cool and laid back, there is plenty of room (even on a Saturday night it didn't feel too crowded) and tables for those that just want to sit down and chill.  There's a great selection of drinks and cocktails and it was all decently priced.  They also serve tapas, although I didn't have a chance to try any.  The music was good, as was the service.  All in all, a great place to stop in and have a drink if you're out and about in the Mission.
author: Dana G.

description: Came with a group of 6 friends on a wednesday night. We were looking for a place where some of us could eat, some of us could drink, and all of us could  talk and hear each other (gosh I sound old!). After going to Trick dog for a rowdy three minutes, we found Asiento around the corner. The bartender was cute, there was live music playing at the perfect volume, there are board games you can use, and lots of clusters of friend groups like our own just having a great time. I had the tinga de pollo tostadas which were  yum and only $8. Friends had the beet salad, albondigas, and patatas bravas. We all had cocktails which were unique and yummy. My only ish is that they dont have straws. I know it's SF and we all should be green conscious, but sometimes a girl likes a straw in her drink. Solution? The bartender handed me a piece of red licorice to use as a makeshift straw. haha. creative, but not the same, and totally changed the taste of my beverage. I would totally go back, straws or no straws!
author: Kassaundra G.

description: Place is really fun, food is great and a real mellow crowd. Monday night pub quiz on the night we came in.  The board games remind you a bit of college or camping when you sit around a table with all your friendsdrinking fun!!
author: Loretta M.

description: I enjoy this bar every time I happen to be in the neighborhood.  Seems I make it a point to get over there more often in the summer since my neighborhood can be so foggy.  The atmosphere is fun and lighthearted and the drinks are always good.  The last time I was there the wife had a Lemon-drop and said it was very, very good!  I had a Mojito, which was as good as they get!  I think what I like most is hanging there after work after a long day for a quick drink and some light food.  The staff is always friendly and the people eclectic.
author: Todd W.

description: I just spent the night at this wonderful bar. It's spacey and cozy at the same time, and it was great place to celebrate my friend's birthday. The owner is very cool and accommodating. The drinks are perfect.
author: Mark A.

description: fun atmosphere, yummy drinks (little expensive). Been here for the monthly reggae show which gets popping.
author: Renee S.

description: My boyfriend and I keep coming back to this place over and over.   The ambiance is laid back and lovely (although the music is a bit loud, but I'm old and cranky like that).  The wines are great and the burger is the best thing I have ever tasted, hands down.  What really makes us want to keep coming back though is the staff.  The bartenders are super sweet and nice.  It's just a great neighborhood bar with really good people.  And that's sadly hard to find these days.  Plus it's got trivia on Monday nights.  A wine bar with tapas and trivia and nice people.  Love it.
author: Molly F.

description: Service can be hit or miss here but I love that they have Brunch that starts at 11am! I always want to do Sunday brunch but also want to sleep in! They also have board games which are a hit for me!
author: Teresa J.

description: I came here for a girls' night catch-up with a good friend on a weeknight. The atmosphere was perfect  - warm and welcoming, but still classy enough to feel like a night out. Their tapas were delicious, and the bartenders were very friendly and gave us great advice about food and wine. Half a star off for prices and another half for loudness,  but I will definitely be coming back here when I feel like shelling out a little extra for a nice-but-fun evening.
author: Zoe L.

description: Ordered the Sparkle Pom, a gingery fizzy treat. The atmosphere here is lively and the ladies running the bar are very cool and super friendly. Everyone here seems to know each other, so it can be a little intimidating being here alone waiting for a friend to arrive. The menu is short and I struggle a bit with the food because most of it is stuff I'm allergic to, but the cheese plate is okay. Parking is atrocious; make sure you take public transport.
author: Michelle L.

description: Went here for happy hour with co-workers, good drinks and great apps.
author: Roman I.

description: Great drinks, friendly staff, warm and welcoming decor.  Haven't tried the food yet, but I will as it looks delicious.
author: Al K.

description: The tapas are pretty good my fav was the crabcakes.  the springrolls aren't so delicious or authentic.  They also have pretty interesting drinks.  The music was decent, it would have been better if there were more songs in the 90s and recent.
author: Jennifer S.

description: I love the fun drinks, small plates, and lounge-y atmosphere.  The place - on a Friday night - was filled with the "right" number of people - not too many (less background din) and not too few.  I will definitely go back.
author: Becky G.

description: The owner is simply wonderful and so accommodating. I planned a very last minute birthday party and it was fabulous.  Great and affordable food and drink.  Bring in your own DJ if you'd like.  I didn't get a chance to check out the boardgames but I'll definitely be going back!
author: Holly G.

description:
if i had to rate asiento purely on service, i'd give it a 5 stars.  several times throughout the night, the bartender came by to ask how we were enjoying our food & drinks, and was extremely friendly.  she even came by to thank us for stopping in before leaving for the night!

i loved the ambience, and it truly qualifies as a solid neighborhood joint.  the space was large, clean and modern, while still feeling homey.  there's one large communal table parallel to the long bar, and a separate area with several small party seating arrangements with comfortable looking leather chairs.  the large windows, which open to let in the breeze, keep the bar cool.

we shared a few small plates, and i liked the tostadas de tinga (chipotle marinated chicken with avocado and chipotle cream) the best.  they were spicy mounds of shredded chicken on top of round tortilla chips.  simple but tasty.  the mixed sausages with mustard dipping sauce was just that - cut up sausages with dipping sauce.  a bit expensive at $8 for what it was, as i could have gone to safeway, bought a package of sausages, pan-fried them and laid them on a platter.  similarly for the mayan adobo chicken tamalitos at $8.

great service, loved the space, and i may come back just to grab a beer and hang out on a sunny day!
author: Janet L.

description: Very friendly staff. Great standout for the neighborhood. Tapas just OK.
author: Bib G.

description: This is a cute little neighborhood bar, but watch your back. My coat got ripped off right from under me when I was sharing a drink with my uncle and cousin. It was on the bar stool next to me then BAM - gone. Keep your stuff close.
author: Christina M.

description: Hosted my birthday here and it was fantastic. Debbie and her crew could not have been easier to work with. My guests loved the food, the cocktails, and the ambiance, and I had a birthday to remember. I'm also in often with a friend can't eat gluten, and the Asiento menu offers a lot of viable options. Great neighborhood bar.
author: Ed K.

description: I don't typically post on yelp but I thought this was pretty terrible. A friend opened a tab at the bar and when I went to transfer the tab to my card, the waitress realized that she had accidentally given my friend's card to a different patron (I.e. closed the wrong tab).  The owner of the bar was actually there.  They apologized but by the time we closed our (new) tab, there was no discount applied to the bill, which was extremely surprising. It seems like if you're going to inconvenience your patron so much as to have them cancel their credit card (and wait a week for a new one), then the least you could do is take a drink or two off the tab. This was hugely disappointing and I don't plan on going back here any time soon.
author: Soraya A.

description: the most delicious - dangerously JUICY little (medium rare) burger i have ever had. soooo yummmmie :) cute little place - all in one. board games, dining and drinks. :) but parking is not easy. :P
author: Sophie L.

description: A breath of fresh air in a neighborhood riddled with the air of under appreciated and intellectually pompous punk rock emo dive bars. Asiento has good music and board games that provide more of a social atmosphere than the usual drab. The bar tenders are jovial and always add to the experience. The tapas. Yum...The shrimp being one of my favorites, I have pretty much eaten everything on the menu and like it all. Reasonable priced organic food always compliments any signature drink. Whether happy hour or a late night snack, Asiento is a welcoming addition to the Mission and I for one am grateful.
author: Ajay K.

description: Okay, second attempt at brunch here. It has been almost a year and I have to say the place has really improved.  The food was great and the service was passable.  One thing - during the "Recovery Brunch" don't pump house music please.  Something a little quieter would be great.
author: Josh P.

description: Although we like the feel of this place, the house music was better suited for a marina bar on 16th street.  We were also a little disappointed that the cheese and salami plate was straight off the Trader Joes shelf.  That said, the wine was delicious and the staff very friendly.  But I'm still gonna have to go with two stars, not sure we'll be back.
author: Blaine B.

description: My friends and I stumbled upon Asiento on our way to dinner the other night. They just opened and are a welcomed addition to the neighborhood.  We were very impressed with the crazy fun staff, wine selection, and yummy cocktails.  Beautiful wood decor and cozy atmosphere.  This would be perfect for a date or a group outing.  I'll definitely be back.
author: Aaron Z.

description: Great neighborhood bar.  Excellent food.  Social, but not too loud.
author: Mira K.

description: Love this place that has come to our hood. We can put kids to bed with sitter, then pop over for tapas and drinks - stay for hours or just one drink. It is a relaxed yet cosmopolitan find in a city full of pretentious cocktail lounges and beauty bars. This is the real deal with witty bartenders, good music, and a rustic aesthetic with an urban edge. Will return again and again.
author: Jennifer F.

description: Met some friends before a night out. Was expecting that we would have to go elsewhere to get a real dinner. The food was fantastic and very reasonably priced. Everything was less than $10 and was all top notch. Drinks were also really good. Some beers on tap that you don't see everywhere and the wine selection was good as well. Definitely will be going back.
author: Mike P.

description: A cool place to hang, have an interesting drink that is yummy; vodka cucumber drink, tapas awsome, except the pork one- no flavor. You can play board games, I like to interact. If you haven't,  go- but like most places bring the party you want and invite the extras.
author: Diana H.

description: Had my 40th b-day party there and it was exactly what I wanted.  Debi was so considerate when I asked to rent out the place, she said I could book the bar at no additional cost and we just started right there to talk about what kind of party I wanted to host.   At no time did she make me feel that what I wanted or how I wanted would be in imposition to her bar and they were more than happy to accommodate.  The food she served was awesome, she hired an extra bar person to ensure good flow of drinks to person and make it easy for me to play my music by having Ipod station etc all ready to rock.  Her staff were super pleasant, the atmosphere was chill and we all had an awesome time dancing till the wee hours.  She even put up my favorite drink on the bar list!  It's not only a great neighborhood bar but many of friends felt like they just discovered a little treasure.  If you are seeking a warm place to have a few drinks and play games or chat, go here.  Or if you are looking for that balance between a fun bar without being too upscale and not too dingy...this is it if you want to party in the Mission.
author: Iris h.

description: wanted to LOVE this neighborhood joint.  had all the makings of a 5-star rating, with its refreshing cocktails, warm space, and plenty of board/card games for those who like a little competition with their cocktails.  however, gotta knock down my rating for their choice of rookie, immature and rude bartenders (or at least the one that we had this past friday evening).  this chick gave us 'tude when we took longer than 10 seconds to pick a drink and then acted like she was doing us a huge favor bringing our food to our table (aka her job, and she wasn't even that busy--there was 15 people in the bar).  thanks but no thanks, i came to drink and have a good time, not to be snubbed.  at least until i know they will be choosier with their hiring!
author: caroline h.
